Social gamers—those who like to play games for primarily social reasons—don’t care so much about intense strategy. In fact, some may perceive that it takes away from the “fun” of the game. They play Monopoly to socialize and to talk with friends. For them, it’s all about the play experience, win or lose. These people can tolerate a greater range of luck, although there still needs to be enough interesting decisions (especially those that affect other players, which leads to social play) to create a reason to play in the first place.

游戏中运气越大，竞争环境就越公平。

The greater the luck in a game, the more even the playing field.

职业球员

PROFESSIONAL PLAYERS

可以专业玩的游戏往往需要极强的技巧。许多此类游戏完全没有运气成分，例如国际象棋和围棋。其他游戏确实需要一些运气，例如扑克和万智牌，但技巧成分大于运气成分（从看到同一群人不断赢得锦标赛可以看出）。例如，扑克中的技巧在于知道要保留什么、何时下注、下注多少以及何时弃牌。

Games that can be played professionally tend to have extremely strong skill components. Many of these games have no luck at all, such as Chess and Go. Others do have some luck, such as Poker and Magic: the Gathering, but the skill elements outweigh the luck (as witnessed by seeing the same people consistently winning tournaments). The skill in Poker, for example, is knowing what to keep, when to bet, how much to bet, and when to fold.

家庭

FAMILIES

有些游戏针对的是一起玩游戏的家庭。这些群体可能包括幼儿、大龄儿童、有竞争力的青少年或成年人以及社交成年人。设计一款能吸引所有年龄段玩家的游戏具有挑战性（但并非不可能—— 《卡坦岛》的商业成功就是明证）。一般来说，家庭游戏往往具有某些特征：

Some games are targeted at families that play games together. These groups may contain a mix of young children, older children, competitive teenagers or adults, and social adults. Designing a game that can appeal to all ages is challenging (but not impossible—witness the commercial success of Settlers of Catan). Generally, family games tend to have certain traits:

·      游戏时间短，以免超出青少年的注意力范围

·      Short playing time, so as not to outlive the attention span of youngsters

·      规则相对简单，可以教给孩子

·      Relatively simple rules, so they can be taught to children

·      一些运气元素，让儿童和社交玩家有机会战胜更具竞争力的玩家

·      Some elements of luck, to allow children and social players to have a chance of winning against the more competitive players

·      一些技巧元素和有趣的决策，让成年人感到有趣和投入

·      Some elements of skill with interesting decisions, to keep the adults entertained and engaged

请注意，一些基于运气的儿童游戏将自己宣传为“家庭”游戏，即使它们没有足够有趣的决定来吸引成年人的兴趣。这就是一些设计师将“家庭游戏”与“儿童游戏”混为一谈的地方。为最低标准而设计并不能制作出更好的游戏；它会导致一款以牺牲其他人为代价让小孩子开心的游戏。

Note that some luck-based children’s games promote themselves as “family” games, even though they do not have enough interesting decisions to keep adults interested. That’s where some designers confuse “family games” with “children’s games.” Designing for the lowest common denominator does not make for a better game; it leads to a game that makes young children happy at the expense of everyone else.

测试运气/技能平衡

PLAYTESTING FOR LUCK/SKILL BALANCE

游戏设计师如何知道他们的游戏运气成分是否过重或不足？当观察目标受众中的游戏测试员时，这一点就会变得显而易见。

How do game designers know if their game has too much luck or not enough? This is something that becomes apparent when observing playtesters who are part of the target audience.

一些常见的警告信号：

Some common warning signals:

·      玩家感到无聊。这可能表明游戏中的运气成分太多，或者有趣决定的出现频率太低。要解决这个问题，可以将一些随机元素转换为玩家决定，或者缩短游戏时长。

·      The players are bored. This can signal that there is too much luck in the game, or that the frequency of interesting decisions is too low. To fix this, convert some random elements to player decisions, or else shorten the length of the game.

·      除了轮到自己，玩家们总是感到无聊。找到一种让玩家通过游戏与其他玩家互动的方法。如果你的玩家不在乎其他玩家何时轮到自己，那么你的游戏就可能达不到应有的沉浸感。或者，让玩家的轮次足够短，这样就没有人需要等待很长时间才能轮到自己。

·      The players are bored on all but their turn. Find a way for players to engage with other players through gameplay. If your players don’t care when other players are taking their turn, odds are your game isn’t as immersive as it could be. Alternatively, make player turns short enough that no one has to wait long for her turn.

·      玩家从未投入，或者似乎不知道该做什么。这可能意味着游戏太复杂，或者有太多决定，或者玩家要处理的信息太多。考虑删除一些决定，要么自动化，要么随机化，或许可以降低规则的复杂性。

·      The players never become engaged, or seem confused about what to do. This can mean that the game is too complicated, or that there are too many decisions, or there is too much information for the players to process. Consider removing some decisions, either by automating them or making them random, and perhaps reducing the complexity of the rules in general.

·      一名玩家以较大优势击败所有其他玩家。如果玩家的技能水平参差不齐，则表明游戏的技能元素过多。为游戏添加一些随机性。另一种可能性是添加负反馈循环，即一些机制，使落后的玩家更容易赶上（有关反馈循环的更多信息，请参阅第 2 章“游戏设计原子”）。

·      One player beats all of the other players by a wide margin. If your players have varying levels of skill, this suggests a game that has too many skill elements. Add some randomness to the game. Another possibility is to add a negative feedback loop, some mechanics that make it easier for players who are behind to catch up (see Chapter 2, “Game Design Atoms,” for more information on feedback loops).

交换运气和技能

EXCHANGING LUCK AND SKILL

有很多具体的方法可以改变游戏中机会和技巧之间的结合，但它们最终都归结为添加或删除随机元素以及添加或删除影响游戏状态的玩家决策。

There are many specific ways to alter the mix between chance and skill in a game, but they all ultimately come down to adding or removing random elements and adding or removing player decisions that affect the state of the game.

添加随机性（掷骰子、洗牌等）会增加游戏中的运气成分。可以通过自动化（“所有玩家在轮到自己时向前移动一个空格”而不是“玩家向前移动 1d6 个空格”）或用玩家决定（“玩家选择在轮到自己时向前移动一到三个空格”）来移除随机元素。

Adding randomness (die rolls, shuffled cards, and so on) increases the amount of luck in the game. Random elements can either be removed by automating them (“All players move forward one space on their turn” instead of “Players move forward 1d6 spaces”) or replacing them with a player decision (“Players choose to move from one to three spaces forward on their turn”).

可以通过替换自动规则来添加决策。例如，在《大富翁》的印刷规则中，玩家总是掷骰子并在棋盘上向前移动那么多格。如果用决策来代替这一点（比如，“您可以选择在掷骰子前支付 50 美元，如果您这样做，则您掷三个骰子并从中选择任意两个骰子进行掷骰”），那么游戏就会获得真正的玩家决策。

Decisions can be added by replacing automatic rules. For example, in the printed rules of Monopoly, the player always rolls the dice and moves forward that many spaces on the board. If this were replaced by a decision (say, “You may choose to pay $50 before rolling, and if you do then you roll three dice and choose any two for your roll”), then the game gains an actual player decision.

请记住，“玩家决策”可能涉及思考决策，但这还包括数字游戏中常见的瞬间灵活性（“抽搐”）元素。像吉他英雄、舞蹈舞蹈革命或经典街机游戏田径这样的游戏，虽然几乎不需要策略，但仍然被认为是高度基于技术的。有趣的是，当抽搐游戏超出玩家的技能时，它就变成了该玩家的“运气”。例如，在像光晕这样的第一人称射击游戏中，射击敌人的头部会自动杀死敌人。对于优秀的玩家来说，这些“爆头”是游戏技巧的一部分。对于初学者来说，爆头只是偶尔发生，并且只是偶然发生，所以它是一个机会因素。具有讽刺意味的是，这意味着在游戏中添加极其困难的抽搐元素实际上可以扩大初学者和专家之间的差距，因为专家可以利用它而初学者不能。

Remember that “player decisions” can involve thinking decisions, but this also includes the split-second dexterity (“twitch”) elements that are common in digital games. Games like Guitar Hero, Dance Dance Revolution, or the classic arcade game Track and Field, while requiring little in the way of strategy, are still considered highly skill-based. Interestingly, when a twitch game exceeds a player’s skill, it becomes “luck” for that player. For example, in an FPS like Halo, shooting an enemy in the head is an automatic kill. For good players, these “head shots” are part of the skill of the game. For beginners, a head shot only happens occasionally, and only by accident, so it is an element of chance. Ironically, this means that adding an extremely difficult twitch element to a game can actually widen the gap between beginner and expert, because experts can exploit it while beginners can’t.

另外，请记住，除了简单的随机掷骰子或洗牌之外，还存在一些偶然因素。即使信息不是随机的，玩家也不知道这些信息。这可能包括敌方单位的位置或战斗力，或者对手是否计划接下来掷石头、剪刀或布。

Also, remember that there are elements of chance beyond simple random die rolls or shuffled decks of cards. Information that is concealed from the players involves chance, even if that information is not random. This may include things such as the location or combat strength of enemy units, or whether the opponent is planning to throw rock, paper, or scissors next.

运气与技能的结合

COMBINING LUCK AND SKILL

从本质上讲，所有游戏都由机会、抽搐技巧或战略技巧主导。游戏可能包含其中两种甚至三种元素，但其中一种元素对游戏结果的影响最大。

At their heart, all games are dominated by chance, twitch skill, or strategic skill. Games may have elements of two or even all three of these, but one always has the strongest influence on the game’s outcome.

机会游戏

GAMES OF CHANCE

主要依靠运气的游戏通常分为两类：儿童游戏和赌博游戏。对于儿童游戏，添加少量战略技巧元素是可以接受的，甚至可以使游戏更像成人喜欢的家庭游戏。添加抽搐技巧也是可能的，但如果游戏是供儿童和父母之间玩的，那么必须注意不要给成年人带来不公平的优势。例如，要求玩家在短时间内拿起尽可能多的牌的游戏会给手大的成年玩家带来优势。

Games that are primarily chance tend to fall into one of two categories: children’s games and gambling games. For children’s games, adding elements of strategic skill is acceptable in small amounts, and can even make the game into more of a family game that’s palatable to adults. Adding twitch skill is also possible, but if the game is meant to be played between children and their parents, then care must be taken not to give an unfair advantage to the adult. For example, a game that requires players to pick up as many cards as possible in a short period of time gives an advantage to a grown player with large hands.

对于赌博游戏来说，添加技巧元素（任何一种）都是完全有可能的，如果这些元素足够强大，它们甚至可以将游戏转变为主要基于技巧的游戏。台球是一种基于抽搐的游戏。扑克是一种基于策略的游戏。这两种游戏通常都是为了钱而玩的。

For gambling games, adding elements of skill (either kind) is quite possible, and if those elements are strong enough, they can even convert the game to being primarily skill-based. Billiards is a twitch-based game. Poker is a strategy-based game. Both are often played for money.

此外，即使是技巧的幻觉也足以让一些赌博游戏变得更有趣。轮盘赌和基诺等赌场游戏纯粹是靠运气，但它们涉及玩家选择下注的数字的决定。一些玩家觉得赢或输总是在他们手中，因为他们有自由选择，这给原本乏味的游戏增添了引人注目的元素。

Additionally, even the illusion of skill is enough to make some gambling games more interesting. Casino games like Roulette and Keno are pure luck, but they involve the player decision of choosing what numbers to bet on. Some players feel that winning or losing is always in their power, since they have free choice, and this adds a compelling element to an otherwise dull game.

技巧游戏

GAMES OF TWITCH SKILL

在以抽搐为基础的游戏中很难加入太多运气或策略。抽搐游戏的乐趣来自于对困难的灵巧挑战的掌握。想想《大神》中一些更具挑战性的绘画谜题。任何机会元素都会剥夺玩家对结果的控制权，从而降低玩家掌握游戏的能力，从而使游戏变得不那么有趣。想象一下，如果你在射击游戏中瞄准了完美的一枪，然后你的枪卡住了；这会很有趣吗，还是你会觉得你被抢了？

It is difficult to add much luck or strategy to a primarily twitch-based game. The fun of twitch games comes from the mastery of a difficult dexterity challenge. Think of some of the more challenging painting puzzles in Okami. Any elements of chance serve to remove control of the outcome from the player, which reduces the ability of a player to master the game, which in turn makes the game less fun. Imagine if you just lined up the perfect shot in a shooting game and then your gun jammed; would this be fun, or would you feel like you were robbed?

战术元素在 Twitch 游戏中很常见，尤其是那些涉及射击的游戏。然而，更重策略的游戏（尤其是回合制游戏）可能会造成干扰，并可能使玩家脱离游戏的节奏。Twitch 游戏是一种肾上腺素激增的游戏，而停止动作以便玩家制定策略有点像跑了五英里然后每隔几分钟停下来做填字游戏。

Tactical elements are common in twitch games, especially those that involve shooting. However, heavier strategy (especially of the turn-based variety) can be disruptive and can remove the player from the flow of the game. Twitch games are an adrenaline rush, and stopping the action so the player can strategize is a bit like going on a five-mile run and then stopping every few minutes to do a crossword puzzle.

策略技巧游戏

GAMES OF STRATEGIC SKILL

讽刺的是，虽然在 twitch 游戏中添加策略令人不安，但在策略游戏中添加少量 twitch 元素却是一种令人愉快的方式，可以用一点动作来打破冗长的策略。想想史诗级 RPG 中嵌入的基于 twitch 的迷你游戏的流行程度。

Ironically, while adding strategy to a twitch game is unsettling, adding minor twitch elements to a strategy game can be a pleasant way to break up long stretches of strategy with a bit of action. Consider the popularity of twitch-based mini-games embedded in epic RPGs.

在策略游戏中加入运气元素可以扩大玩家群体，让不同水平的玩家都能参与游戏，同时仍允许较弱的玩家偶尔获胜。另一方面，如果玩家觉得他获胜只是因为抽到好牌或掷出好骰子，过多的运气元素会降低获胜的刺激感。最终，可以接受的运气元素数量取决于目标受众。竞技游戏玩家通常只能容忍少量的运气元素，而社交和家庭游戏玩家可以接受较大的运气元素。

Adding luck to a strategy game can widen the audience by allowing players of differing skill levels to play, while still allowing the weaker player to win occasionally. On the other hand, too much luck can take the thrill out of winning, if a player feels that he only won because of favorable card draws or die rolls. Ultimately, the amount of luck that is acceptable to add depends on the target audience. Competitive gamers will generally tolerate only a small amount of luck, while social and family gamers can accept larger amounts.

挑战

CHALLENGES

在以下挑战中，您需要采用现有游戏并调整技能和运气之间的组合。祝您好运。或者，祝您技术高超，这取决于您如何看待它。

In the following challenges, you are asked to take existing games and modify the mix between skill and chance. Good luck. Or, good skill, depending on how you look at it.

挑战 1——儿童面临的风险

CHALLENGE 1—RISK FOR KIDS

策略棋盘游戏Risk 适合年龄较大的儿童和青少年，但其战略决策部分足以让年龄较小的儿童感到不知所措。这很遗憾，因为该游戏有许多色彩鲜艳的游戏元素，对年轻玩家很有吸引力（前提是孩子年龄足够大，不会吃这些元素）。

The strategy board game Risk is appropriate for older children and teenagers, but has enough strategic decision making to overwhelm younger children. This is a shame, because it has many colorful game bits that would be enticing to a young player (provided the kid is old enough not to eat them).

为这款棋盘游戏创建一种规则变体，删除许多战略元素并用机会取而代之，以便五至八岁的儿童可以玩。

Create a rules variant for this board game that removes many of the strategic elements and replaces them with chance, in order to make it playable by children ages five to eight.

所需组件

Components Required

·      棋盘游戏副本

·      Copy of the board game

可交付成果

Deliverable

·      书面规则变体

·      Written rules variant

建议流程

Suggested Process

1.    阅读规则。 将规则分解为技巧和机会元素。

1.    Read the rules. Break down the rules into skill and chance elements.

2.    系统地将技能转变为机会。想办法消除决策因素或引入机会因素。

2.    Systematically change skill into chance. Think of ways to remove decision-making elements or introduce elements of chance.

3.    简化、简化、再简化。记住目标受众。尽可能降低规则的复杂性。查看其他儿童游戏的完整规则，例如Chutes and Ladders、Candy Land和Sorry!。尝试让您的规则具有类似的复杂性和大约相同的段落数。您可以随意添加或删除有助于实现此目的的组件。

3.    Simplify, simplify, simplify. Remember the target audience. Reduce the complexity of your rules wherever possible. Look at the complete rules for other children’s games, like Chutes and Ladders, Candy Land, and Sorry!. Try to get your rules to a similar complexity and about the same number of paragraphs. Feel free to add or remove components that would help you achieve this.

4.    缩短游戏时间。原版游戏的持续时间超过了一般儿童的注意力持续时间。进一步修改规则，将游戏时间保持在 30 分钟左右。

4.    Shorten the playing time. The original game lasts longer than a typical child’s attention span. Modify your rules further to keep the playing time around 30 minutes or so.

变体

Variant

使用不同的策略棋盘游戏。例如国际象棋、Stratego和Othello。为了增加挑战性，不要制作儿童游戏，而要制作家庭游戏

Use a different strategy board game. Some examples are Chess, Stratego, and Othello. For additional challenge, instead of making a children’s game, make it a family game

适合所有年龄段的人。

that can appeal to all ages.

挑战 2——成人儿童游戏

CHALLENGE 2—ADULT CHILDREN’S GAMES

Pretty Pretty Princess是一款儿童游戏，几乎不需要任何技巧。游戏为每位玩家提供公主服装 — 耳环、戒指、手镯和项链。还有一个皇冠。最先收集到所有公主服装和皇冠的人将赢得游戏。玩家使用旋转器在棋盘上移动，旋转器会告诉他们要去哪里以及要拾取什么物品。一些空间列出了要拾取的特定物品，而其他空间则让玩家选择物品。游戏还附带一个黑色戒指，这会阻止玩家获胜，直到其他人被迫从他们手中夺走戒指。玩家定期从对方那里拿走东西，并将东西放回罐子中。

Pretty Pretty Princess is a children’s game with virtually no skill involved. The game comes complete with princess attire for each player—earrings, a ring, a bracelet, and a necklace. There is also a single crown. The person to collect all her pieces first, as well as the crown, wins the game. Players move around the board by using a spinner that tells them where to go and what item to pick up. Some spaces list a specific item to pick up, while others give the player their choice of items. The game also comes with a black ring, which prevents the player from winning until someone else is forced to take the ring from them. Players periodically take things from each other and put things back in the pot, too.

修改此游戏的规则，使其成为一款家庭游戏，以便成年人也能享受其中的乐趣。您可以自由更改游戏的整体叙事，但游戏的基本结构必须保持不变。

Modify the rules of this game to make it a family game, so that it is more interesting to adults, too. You are free to change the overall narrative of the game, but the basic structure of play must remain the same.

所需组件

Components Required

·      原版游戏的副本

·      Copy of the original game

可交付成果

Deliverable

·      书面规则变体

·      Written rules variant

建议流程

Suggested Process

1.    将机会变成技巧。与上一个挑战一样，确定游戏的各个机制，以便了解可以修改哪些内容以添加决策或消除随机性。

1.    Change chance into skill. As in the previous challenge, identify the individual mechanics of the game so that you know what could be modified to add decisions or remove randomness.

2.    不要走得太远。请记住，修改后的游戏应该让孩子和成人都感到愉快。游戏时间要短，主题要一致，还要保留一些偶​​然元素。不要添加太多规则或太深奥的决策，以免孩子无法玩下去。

2.    Don’t go too far. Remember that the modified game should still be enjoyable by kids, as well as adults. Keep the playing time short, keep the theme, and keep some elements of chance. Don’t add so many rules or such deep decision making that it’s impossible for kids to play.

3.    创建可交付成果。

3.    Create deliverable.

变体

Variant

使用不同的儿童游戏。例如“Chutes and Ladders”、“Candy Land”和“War”纸牌游戏。

Use a different children’s game. Examples include Chutes and Ladders, Candy Land, and the card game War.

为了改变节奏，不要将其打造成家庭游戏，而是将其打造成针对有竞争力的成年人的游戏。（这样做需要添加更深层次的战略元素并删除大部分机会。）在这种情况下，您修改后的游戏可能会与原版截然不同。

For a change of pace, instead of making this into a family game, make it a game targeted at competitive adults. (Doing this requires adding much deeper strategic elements and removing most of the chance.) In this case, your modified game is likely to be extremely different from the original.

挑战 3——战略迷雾

CHALLENGE 3—FOG OF STRATEGY

对于这一挑战，请选择一款完全基于技能、非数字化且没有任何运气元素的游戏，例如四子棋、国际象棋或围棋。为了让这款游戏适合竞争性较低的玩家，你需要增加一些运气。具体来说，就是添加“战争迷雾”：除非在某些条件下，否则对手的棋子对你来说是隐藏的（反之亦然）。在视频游戏中，当使用战争迷雾时，意味着你只能看到游戏中角色看到的东西。因此，如果你的角色的视线被山或房子挡住，你也看不到那里的东西。有些游戏会使用云层来产生这种效果。其他游戏则只在敌人或物体进入角色的视线内才显示它们。在这个非数字化挑战中，如果对手的棋子在你的一定方格范围内，你也许可以看到它们，或者你可以选择在你的轮到你时查看特定的方格。在游戏环境中如何定义“可见范围”取决于你。

For this challenge, choose an entirely skill-based, non-digital game with no elements of chance at all, such as Connect Four, Chess, or Go. To adapt this game for less competitive players, you’re going to add some chance. Specifically, add “fog of war”: your opponent’s pieces are hidden from you (and vice versa) except under certain conditions. In video games, when a fog of war is used, it means that you can only see what your characters in the game see. So, if your character’s sight is blocked by a mountain or a house, you can’t see what’s there either. Some games employ cloud cover to give this effect. Others just don’t show enemies or objects until they are in the character’s line of sight. In this non-digital challenge, maybe you can see your opponent’s pieces if they are within a certain number of squares of yours, or maybe you can choose to look at a specific square on your turn. It is up to you how “visible range” is defined in the context of the game.

您可以根据需要更改游戏规则以支持战争迷雾，但尽量保持游戏精神不变。

You may change the rules of the game as needed to support fog of war, but try to keep the spirit of the game intact otherwise.

所需组件

Components Required

·      您正在修改的游戏的副本

·      Copy of the game that you are modifying

可交付成果

Deliverable

·      修改游戏的书面规则

·      Written set of rules for the modified game

建议流程

Suggested Process

1.    解释“战争迷雾”。战争迷雾在数字游戏中比在非数字游戏中更常见，因为计算机可以跟踪隐藏的信息。在非数字游戏中，如果不使用不玩游戏的人作为主持人，这种情况会更加困难。想办法向一个玩家或另一个玩家隐藏信息，而不需要玩家验证彼此的动作或提供他们自己不知道的信息。

1.    Interpret “fog of war.” Fog of war is more common in digital than non-digital games, because the computer can keep track of hidden information. In non-digital games this is more difficult without using a person who is not playing to be a moderator. Think of ways to hide information from one player or the other, without requiring the players to verify each other’s moves or provide information that they don’t know themselves.

2.    尝试一下。玩一下修改后的游戏。隐藏信息对游戏玩法有什么影响？您是否觉得它更依赖运气？您是否觉得修改后的游戏比原版更有趣？

2.    Try it out. Play your modified game. What effect does hidden information have on the gameplay? Do you feel it is more luck-based? Do you find the modification more fun than the original?

3.    创建可交付成果。

3.    Create deliverable.

变体

Variant

一款以战争迷雾为主要机制的非数字游戏是棋盘游戏《战舰》，玩家轮流猜测网格上的某个位置，试图找到对手隐藏的船只。然而，如果战争迷雾被移除，这款游戏就没有什么策略可言了。它本质上是一款猜谜游戏，因此运气成分大于技巧成分。

One well-known non-digital game that features fog of war as its primary mechanic is the board game Battleship, where players take turns guessing a location on a grid in an attempt to locate the opponent’s hidden ships. However, this game would offer little strategy if the fog of war were removed. It is essentially a guessing game, thus containing more luck than skill.

不要拿一款策略游戏来添加战争迷雾，而是尝试拿一款战争迷雾游戏《战舰》 来添加策略元素。修改规则，这样即使你能 看到对手的棋盘，它仍然是一款有效的策略游戏（但即使你看不到对手的棋盘，游戏仍然可以玩）。

Instead of taking a strategy game and adding fog of war, try taking the fog of war game Battleship and adding strategy elements. Modify the rules so that, even if you could see your opponent’s board, it would still be a valid strategy game (but the game is still playable even if you can’t see your opponent’s board).

挑战 4 — 休闲地震

CHALLENGE 4—CASUAL QUAKE

像《毁灭战士》、《雷神之锤》和《光环》这样的第一人称射击游戏通常被认为是“硬核”玩家的天下。从未玩过这类游戏的人可能会被经验丰富的玩家彻底击败。让我们试着让竞争环境更公平一些。

First person shooter games like Doom, Quake, and Halo are often considered the realm of the “hard-core” gamer. Someone who has never played a game like this can get absolutely crushed by an experienced player. Let’s try to even the playing field.

对于这一挑战，请为原创 FPS（或现有 FPS 的模组）创建一个概念，让技术水平较低的玩家更容易接受。减少玩家技能（在本例中主要是身体技能）对游戏结果的影响。您还可以自由修改叙事，使其更适合这些玩家。

For this challenge, create a concept for an original FPS (or a mod to an existing FPS) that is more accessible to less skilled players. Decrease the impact that player skill (primarily physical skill, in this case) has on the outcome of the game. You’re also free to modify the narrative to make it more palatable to these players.

所需组件

Components Required

·      至少有一款该类型的游戏或互联网连接（用于研究）

·      At least one game in this genre or an Internet connection (for research)

可交付成果

Deliverable

·      包含游戏功能列表的概念文档

·      Concept doc that includes a list of gameplay features

建议流程

Suggested Process

1.    研究游戏类型。 如果你不熟悉 FPS 类型，可以玩一些这种类型的游戏，或者阅读 FPS 游戏的评论，或者采访经常玩 FPS 的朋友或同事。是否有一些 FPS 游戏被认为比其他游戏更“适合新手”？哪些 FPS 游戏对赢得锦标赛的人来说更有吸引力，因为这些游戏被认为更依赖技能？“休闲”和“硬核”FPS 游戏之间的机制有何不同？

1.    Research the genre. If you’re unfamiliar with the FPS genre, play some games of this type, or read reviews of FPS games, or interview friends or colleagues who play them heavily. Are there some FPS games that are considered more “newbie-friendly” than others? Which FPSs carry more prestige for people who win tournaments, because the games are considered more skill based? What mechanics differ between the “casual” and “hard-core” FPS games?

2.    识别技能要素。FPS游戏中的技能来自哪里？想办法修改它。请注意，仅仅让游戏更难玩（例如让十字准线不可预测地来回摆动，或允许爆头自动获胜）实际上会让游戏更加依赖技能，而不是更少。技能极强的玩家很快就能学会弥补增加的难度，而技能较差的玩家仍然受到系统的制约。

2.    Identify the elements of skill. Where does the skill in FPS games come from? Think of ways to modify it. Note that simply making the game more difficult to play (such as having the crosshairs sway back and forth unpredictably, or allowing head shots to be an automatic win) actually make the game more skill-based, not less. Extremely skilled players quickly learn to compensate for the added difficulty, while less skilled players remain handicapped by the system.

3.    集思广益。列出你能想到的所有方法，让一款 FPS 更容易被更广泛的受众接受，但不要删除使其成为一款 FPS 的关键功能。

3.    Brainstorm. Make a list of every way you can think of to make an FPS more accessible to a wider audience, without removing the key features that make it an FPS in the first place.

4.    创建可交付成果。

4.    Create deliverable.

铁人设计师挑战赛 5 — 硬核/休闲

IRON DESIGNER CHALLENGE 5—HARDCORE/CASUAL

对于这个挑战，选择一款以“休闲”游戏为卖点的游戏。例如Bejeweled、 Peggle和Chuzzle。如果你参加这个挑战的人足够多，可以组成几个团队，那么让每个团队选择一个游戏来挑战其他人。

For this challenge, choose a game that is marketed as a “casual” game. Examples include Bejeweled, Peggle, and Chuzzle. If you are doing this challenge with enough people to form several teams, have each team choose a game to inflict on someone else.

对于您分配的游戏，请提出一个针对竞争激烈的硬核玩家市场的修改版本。大多数休闲游戏都是单人游戏，只要假设有高分榜或排行榜，游戏就可以保持这种状态。考虑支持锦标赛的方式，尽可能消除运气因素，以便更熟练的玩家能够持续获胜。

With the game you’re assigned, propose a modified version aimed at the competitive, hard-core gamer market. Most casual games are one player, and the game can remain so, as long as it is assumed there is a high-score list or leaderboard. Consider ways to support tournament play that remove as much luck as possible, so that the more skilled players can consistently win.

所需组件

Components Required

·      一些休闲游戏的副本或互联网连接（用于研究）

·      Copies of some casual games or an Internet connection (for research)

可交付成果

Deliverable

·      新游戏设计/修改的描述

·      Description of new game design/modifications

·      书面段落描述可以添加的其他元游戏元素，以支持健康的竞争环境

·      Written paragraph describing additional metagame elements that could be added to support a healthy competitive environment

建议流程

Suggested Process

1.    玩游戏。 有多少是技巧？有多少是运气？有多少是技巧但感觉像是运气，或者反之亦然？如果游戏不可用，请阅读有关游戏的评论或玩家评论，或采访您认识的玩过该游戏的人。

1.    Play the game. How much of it is skill? How much is luck? How much is skill but feels like luck, or vice versa? If the game is unavailable, read reviews or player comments about the game, or interview someone you know who has played it.

2.    集思广益，提出修改意见。 您可以添加哪些元素来提高游戏的技巧性？请注意，这并不一定意味着删除随机元素。例如，俄罗斯方块使用一系列随机的方块，但如果玩家知道当前方块之后的下一个方块是什么，就可以更好地进行规划，从而使游戏更加基于技巧。

2.    Brainstorm modifications. What elements could you add to increase the skill of the game? Note that this doesn’t necessarily mean removing random elements. For example, Tetris uses a random series of blocks, but if the player is notified of what the next block will be after the current one, it allows for better planning and the game is more skill-based as a result.

3.    创建可交付成果。

3.    Create deliverable.

变体

Variant

不要玩电子游戏，而要玩在社交或家庭场合经常玩的纸牌或棋盘游戏。例如Hearts、Scrabble和Settlers of Catan。

Instead of a digital game, use a card or board game that is often played in a social or family setting. Examples include Hearts, Scrabble, and Settlers of Catan.

非数字短片

NON-DIGITAL SHORTS

将技能和运气混合在一起，并在各个层面上进行游戏会产生有趣的游戏动态，有时会导致意想不到的奇怪游戏。这些短片鼓励您探索将这些元素引入游戏的不同方式。

Mixing up skill and luck and playing with the various levels of each produces interesting play dynamics, sometimes resulting in odd play that you hadn’t expected. These shorts encourage you to explore the different ways to bring these elements to games.

1.选取任意传统的儿童游戏并进行修改，使成人能够享受其中的乐趣。    

1.     Take any traditional children’s game and modify it so that it is enjoyable to adults.

2.为您选择的任何儿童游戏添加竞价机制。例如，想象一下，如果您为Candy Land添加竞价会发生什么。    

2.     Add a bidding mechanic to any children’s game of your choice. Consider, for example, what would happen if you added bidding to Candy Land.

3.根据当前的 CNN.com 标题创建一个基于图块的游戏，主要使用技巧，但仍包含一些随机元素。游戏不得使用图块以外的任何元素制作。    

3.     Create a tile-based game based on the current CNN.com headline that primarily uses skill, but still has some random element. The game may not be made with anything other than tiles.

4.选择一项极其危险的工作，并制作一款融合技巧和运气的游戏。    

4.     Select an incredibly dangerous job and make a game about it that integrates both skill and luck.

5.观察孩子们玩耍。然后制作一个与他们玩耍有关的游戏，以模仿他们玩耍时所需的技巧和运气。    

5.     Watch children playing. Then make a game about their play that replicates the skill and luck involved in their play.

6.任何规则都有例外。创建一个完全没有运气成分的家庭游戏。    

6.     Every rule has exceptions. Create a family game that has no luck elements at all.

7.修改主要依赖运气的游戏规则，使其由技巧主导。    

7.     Take a primarily luck-based game and modify the rules so that it is instead dominated by twitch skill.

8.尝试创建一款具有同等机会、抽搐技巧和战略技巧元素的纸牌游戏，且其中任何一种元素都不会超过其他元素。测试您的创作，并在其似乎由一种机会或技巧主导时不断修改组合。    

8.     Try to create a card game that has equal elements of chance, twitch skill, and strategic skill without any single one outweighing the others. Playtest your creation and keep modifying the mix whenever it seems dominated by one type of chance or skill.

9.在扑克游戏中，反复玩牌使游戏更注重技巧而非运气。在糖果乐园游戏中，无论你玩多少次，还是靠运气。考虑一下这两种游戏之间的差异，然后为糖果乐园添加一个或多个规则，使其在单轮游戏中依靠运气，而在整场游戏中依靠技巧。    

9.     In Poker, repeated play makes the game more focused on skill than luck. In Candy Land, no matter how much you play, it’s still luck. Consider the differences between the two games, then add one or more rules to Candy Land that keeps it luck-based on a single turn, but skill-based over the play of an entire game.

10.尝试与两个或更多玩家一起玩这款游戏设计游戏。首先，选择任何可用的非数字游戏。然后，让一名玩家选择一种机制并掷骰子（1、2 = 机会；3、4 = 战略技能；5、6 = 抽搐技能）。如果掷出的骰子已经与机制匹配，则再次掷骰子。然后，另一名玩家必须根据掷出的骰子修改机制以使用新的机会或技能，同时仍保持游戏的可玩性和趣味性。看看你能用这种方式修改多少规则，直到游戏中的某些规则被破坏。 

10.  Try this game–design game with two or more players. First, select any non-digital game that you have available. Then, have one player choose a mechanic and roll a die (1,2 = chance; 3,4 = strategic skill; 5,6 = twitch skill). Roll again if your die roll matches the mechanic already. Another player then must modify the mechanic to use the new kind of chance or skill based on the die roll, while still keeping the game playable and fun. See how many rules you can modify in this way until something in the game breaks.

 

 

第三部分：编写游戏概念

Part III: Writing Game Concepts


 

 

9：什么是知识产权

9: What is Intellectual Property

马里奥。麦登橄榄球。士官长。毁灭公爵。劳拉·克劳馥。每个名字都是电子游戏中的黄金，并受到其主人的精心培育和严密保护。

Mario. Madden. Master Chief. Duke Nukem. Lara Croft. Each name is video game gold and simultaneously nurtured and fiercely protected by its owners.

在游戏和其他行业中，这种黄金被称为“知识产权”或 IP。简而言之，知识产权是某人或某物拥有的一个想法或一组想法，是创造性劳动的结果。快速浏览任何游戏零售商或在线网站的货架，就会发现 IP 在游戏中有多么普遍。事实上，在任何一年中，大多数畅销游戏都源自现有的 IP。这些游戏要么是该系列之前游戏的续集，要么是通常与主要电影上映同时进行的授权游戏。

In the game and other industries, that gold is referred to as “intellectual property,” or IP. In a nutshell, intellectual property is an idea or a collection of ideas that is owned by someone or something and is the result of creative work. A quick scan of the shelves of any game retailer or online site reveals just how pervasive IPs are in games. In fact, in any given year, the majority of best-selling game titles are derived from pre-existing IP. These games are either sequels to previous games in the series or licensed titles usually coinciding with a major movie release.

授权 IP 的盛行导致一些人认为游戏创新已死。他们认为，使用 IP 时，不可能留下自己的印记。其他人甚至在使用 IP 时也找到了创新的空间。毕竟，对于游戏而言，创新并不体现在名称上，而是体现在新的游戏机制上。似乎每个人都同意的一件事是，无论好坏，IP 都是专业游戏制作现实的一部分。

The preponderance of licensed IPs leads some to say innovation in games is dead. They reason that when using IP, it’s impossible to leave a mark all your own. Others find room for innovation even while using an IP. After all, when it comes to games, innovation isn’t found in the name, but rather in new game mechanics. The one thing that everyone seems to agree on is that, for better or worse, IPs are part of the reality of making games professionally.

知识产权类型

TYPES OF IP

IP 有多种形式，从价值惊人的 IP 到一文不值。在游戏行业中，经常讨论的 IP 有三种基本类型：

IP comes in several forms, from amazingly valuable to utterly worthless. In the game industry, three basic types of IP are frequently discussed:

·      原创 IP 由 IP 持有者开发或为其开发，在游戏行业中，由发行商或开发商拥有。IP 尚未与任何其他游戏或任何媒介中的任何产品相关联。成功的原创 IP（如《魔兽争霸》或《光环》）对 IP 持有者来说非常有利可图，因为无需支付许可费。我们往往不会再听到失败 IP 的消息，除非它们非常失败，在这种情况下，它们会出现在 YouTube 上（通常受到强烈嘲笑）。

·      Original IP is developed by or for the IP holder and, in the case of the game industry, is owned by the publisher or developer. The IP has yet to be attached to any other game or any product in any medium. Successful original IPs like Warcraft or Halo are very profitable for the IP holders since no licensing fees need be paid. We tend not to hear from unsuccessful IPs again unless they are embarrassingly unsuccessful, in which case they show up (usually heavily mocked) on YouTube.

·      授权 IP 是已存在的 IP，由发行商或开发商授权用于视频游戏。《蜘蛛侠》、 《龙与地下城》和《NBA》都是授权 IP 的例子。发行商支付费用或版税以在其游戏中使用 IP。

·      Licensed IP is pre-existing IP that is licensed for use in a video game by the publisher or developer. Spider-Man, Dungeons & Dragons, and NBA are all examples of licensed IP. Publishers pay a fee or a royalty to use IPs in their games.

·      续集是原创或授权 IP 的后续发行。续集在第 10 章“创作续集”中进行了全面介绍。

·      Sequels are subsequent releases of either original or licensed IP. Sequels are covered in full in Chapter 10, “Creating Sequels.”

简而言之，任何代表有创造价值的思想的集合都是知识产权。

In a nutshell, any collection of ideas that represents something of creative value is IP.

为何选择知识产权？

WHY IP?

出版商和开发商倾向于授权 IP 的主要原因是降低风险。通过与知名的成功作品合作（无论是续集、授权作品还是两者兼有），出版商希望最大限度地提高作品的销量，并尽量减少获得认可和销售所需的费用。

Publishers and developers gravitate toward licensed IP for one reason above all others—risk mitigation. By partnering with known successes—whether a sequel, a licensed title, or both—publishers hope to maximize the sales of the title and minimize the expense required for it to gain recognition and sales.

以EA Sports 的《Madden》系列游戏的 IP 范围为例：

Consider the IP spectrum of the Madden series by EA Sports:

·      约翰·马登

·      John Madden

·      美国职业橄榄球联盟

·      NFL

·      足球队

·      Football teams

·      个人球员

·      Individual players

·       EA体育

·      EA Sports

·      之前的《Madden》游戏

·      Previous Madden titles

这款游戏充满了知识产权。虽然《Madden》系列早已名声大噪，但在早期，该系列游戏以真实球员、真实球队和约翰·马登本人为主角，这一事实对其成功产生了巨大影响。玩家无需打开盒子就能认出游戏名称、球队和玩家，他们也了解游戏的内容。仅凭知识产权，玩家就一定程度上建立了信任。

The game is fully loaded with IP. While the Madden series has long since carried its own weight, in the early days, the fact that it featured the real players, the real teams, and John Madden himself had a tremendous effect on its success. Players recognized the title, the teams, and the players, and they understood what the game was about all without opening the box. The IPs alone carried a certain amount of built-in player trust.

这与广告商为其产品聘请明星代言的原因相同。发行商希望玩家仅凭 IP 就愿意购买游戏，而不管游戏质量如何。Infogrames 的 PC 游戏《幸存者：互动游戏》受到评论家的普遍批评，但仅凭其 IP 实力就取得了良好的销量。   

It’s the same reason advertisers use celebrity endorsements for their products. Publishers hope that players will want to purchase the game based on the IP alone, regardless of the game’s quality. The Infogrames PC title Survivor: the Interactive Game was universally panned by critics, but sold well based on the strength of its IP alone.   

与《Madden》 和其他授权游戏不同，开发商和发行商在给游戏命名时，会创建自己的 IP。如果 IP 发展成一个成功的系列，它可以为其所有者带来惊人的投资回报。例如，《吸血莱恩》、《寂静岭》和《生化危机》等 IP已登上大银幕，成为另一个行业的授权 IP。马里奥本人已出现在 100 多款游戏中，从午餐盒到服装再到书籍，无所不在。

In contrast to Madden and other licensed titles, developers and publishers create their own IP whenever they put a name on a game. If the IP develops into a successful series, it can bring its owner an incredible return on its investment. For instance, IPs like BloodRayne, Silent Hill, and Resident Evil have made it to the big screen, becoming licensed IPs in another industry. Mario himself has appeared in over 100 games and been featured on everything from lunch boxes to clothing to books.

使用 IP

WORKING WITH AN IP

虽然大多数专业人士都愿意开发自己的原创 IP（没有哪个游戏开发者，无论是现实中的还是潜在的，没有游戏创意），但现实情况是，主流游戏行业中的大多数人至少会在其职业生涯的一部分时间里开发与授权相关的游戏。通常，开发者也无法选择他们使用什么授权。相反，你会获得一个授权，并被告知要尽你所能地使用它来制作游戏。有时，你可以与《星球大战》合作；其他时候，你会得到《芭比马历险记》。

While most professionals would like to work on their own original IP—there’s not a game developer out there, real or potential, who doesn’t have an idea for a game—the reality is that most in the mainstream game industry will be working on games attached to a license for at least part of their career. Generally, developers don’t get to choose what license they work with, either. Rather, you are given a license and told to make a game with it as best you can. Sometimes, you get to work with Star Wars; other times you get Barbie Horse Adventures.

这是如何发生的？在许多情况下，出版商会联系开发人员，然后开发人员会联系设计部门。“BigName Publisher 正在寻求 [在此处插入 IP 名称] 的提案。”这可能是一部电视节目、一部电影或一本书。然后，设计师将负责创建提案（称为“宣传”），以便公司将其交给 BigName Publisher。通常，设计师并不是独自完成这项工作。BigName Publisher 可能已经联系了五六位开发人员，希望从中挑选出最好的。

How does this happen? In many cases, a publisher will approach a developer and that developer will in turn approach the design department. “BigName Publisher is looking to get a proposal for [insert IP name here].” It might be a television show, a movie, or a book. The designers will then be tasked with creating a proposal—known as a “pitch”—for the company to hand over to BigName Publisher. Usually, designers aren’t alone in this effort, either. BigName Publisher has likely approached five or six developers, hoping to cherry pick the best of the lot.

不过，并不是所有大型发行商和大牌都能参与其中。随着严肃游戏市场的增长，IP 的范围让开发者眼花缭乱，要求所有游戏设计师都变得异常多才多艺。企业培训游戏、广告游戏、Flash 游戏、在线游戏、棋盘游戏和 ARG 都为 IP 领域做出了贡献。可以想象，设计一款Home Depot游戏就像开发系列中的第三款游戏一样容易，就像 Neversoft 完成《吉他英雄 III》的方式一样。

It’s not all big publishers and big names, though. With the growth of the serious game market, the range of IPs has become somewhat dizzying for developers and requires all game designers to become exceptionally versatile. Corporate training games, advergames, flash games, online games, board games, and ARGs all contribute to the IP landscape. It’s quite conceivable that one could be designing a Home Depot game just as easily as one could be working on the third game in a series, similar to the way Neversoft completed Guitar Hero III.

幸运的是，对于设计师来说，所需的技能是相同的：研究、了解你的限制、尊重玩家并开发坚实的核心机制。

Fortunately for designers, the skills required are the same: research, know your constraints, honor the player, and develop a solid core mechanic.

研究

RESEARCH

已故的马龙白兰度经常被说成是一位方法派演员。他全身心地投入到自己的角色中，并活在角色中。他被誉为有史以来最伟大的演员之一并非偶然。对于从事 IP 工作的设计师来说，“方法”过程也非常有效。

The late Marlon Brando was often said to be a method actor. He threw himself wholly into his roles and lived them. It’s no accident that he’s credited as being one of the greatest actors of all time. For designers working on IP, the “method” process works well, too.

它如何应用？

How does it apply?

当设计师首次开始研究某个 IP 时，无论是新 IP 还是已有 IP，他们很可能对它知之甚少。即使他们认为自己了解很多，但在将这些想法付诸实践时，设计师通常会发现他们知道的远比授权商少。粉丝的观点与设计师的观点不同。作为粉丝，你很享受这种体验。作为设计师，你实际上是在试图弄清楚这种体验的哪些方面能让其他人感到兴奋。即使对于新 IP，情况也是如此。如果你的新游戏 IP Boru是基于爱尔兰国王 Brian Boru 的，那么许多爱尔兰历史的粉丝会被你的游戏所吸引，并期望它和你作为设计师具有一定程度的真实性。因此设计师需要做大量研究。当然，你进行的研究量取决于出版商或 IP 持有者期望看到提案之前你有多少时间。你可能有几个月的时间来准备提案，特别是对于发布“RFP”（提案请求）的严肃游戏，也可能只有几个小时。如果你正在开发自己的知识产权，那么你有足够的时间，或者直到你用完融资资金为止

When designers first begin working on an IP, whether new or pre-existing, odds are they know little about it. Even if they think they know a lot, when it comes to putting these thoughts on-screen, designers often find they know a whole lot less than the licensor. The viewpoint of a fan is different from the viewpoint of the designer. As a fan, you’re enjoying the experience. As a designer, you’re actually trying to figure out what about that experience is exciting to others. Even for new IPs, this holds true. If your new game IP Boru is based on the Irish High King Brian Boru, there are many fans of Irish history that will be attracted to your game and expect a certain amount of authenticity from it and from you as its designer. So designers need to do research—a lot. Naturally, the amount of research you do depends on the amount of time that you have before the publisher or IP holder expects to see a proposal. You may have several months to prepare the proposal, particularly for serious games that issue “RFPs” (requests for proposal), or only several hours. If it’s your own IP you’re developing, you have all the time you want or until you run out of money to finance

您的研究，以先到者为准。设计师必须全身心投入到玩家的角色中，并进行出色的研究

your research, whichever comes first. Designers must throw themselves into the player’s role and develop excellent research

在提案通过之前，你需要了解研究来源。知道去哪里进行研究或联系谁是关键，尤其是在开发新 IP 时。对于现有 IP，重要的是要考虑使用相同 IP 开发的先前游戏。没有人喜欢重新发明轮子，了解先前游戏中哪些是正确和错误的是非常有价值的。对比产品也会被分析。如果有人制作了与你的预期产品非常相似或具有类似 IP 的产品，请查看。

sources before a proposal hits. Knowing where to go for that research or whom to contact is key, particularly when developing a new IP. For an existing IP, it’s important to take into account previous games that have been developed using the same IP. No one appreciates a reinvented wheel, and learning what went right and wrong in previous games can be invaluable. Comparative products are also analyzed. If someone’s made something very similar to your intended product or with a similar IP, take a look.

对于学生来说，维基百科是一个常规的起点。然而，它往往仅此而已。由于维基百科是社区生成的知识，因此不能依赖其准确性。事实上，本书作者之一的前雇主名单中充满了错误，缺少了许多关键信息。许多教授也不认为它是一个可靠的、可引用的来源。无论如何，知识产权持有者本身是一个更好的信息来源。任何值得花时间的知识产权都有一个专门的网站，通常由知识产权持有者自己创建。此外，大多数知识产权都有各种各样的文章，大学图书馆，尤其是在线图书馆，是极好的参考资料来源。

For students, Wikipedia is a regular starting place. However, it’s often little more than that. Since Wikipedia is community-generated knowledge, it can’t be relied upon for accuracy. In fact, the listing for a former employer of one of this book’s authors is filled with errors and missing much critical information. Many professors also don’t consider it a credible, citable source. In any case, the IP holder itself is a far better source of information. Any IP worth the time has a Web site devoted to it, usually created by the IP holder itself. Furthermore, most IPs have all kinds of articles written on them, and college libraries, particularly online libraries, are excellent reference sources.

如果你很幸运，你的团队中可能有人是这个电视节目的超级粉丝。这可能是一个严肃的游戏，需要一次或多次现场访问。通常，你所做的最重要的研究将是针对那些提出建议的人提出的一系列简单问题。答案将成为你的约束。

If you’re lucky, someone on your team may be a huge fan of the TV show that’s up for a pitch. It might be a serious game and require one or more on-site visits. Often, the most important research you do will be a series of simple questions directed at those who asked for the proposal. The answers will become your constraints.

了解你的限制

KNOW YOUR CONSTRAINTS

当有人与持有授权 IP 的开发者接洽时，约束对话通常会以以下四种方式之一进行：

When someone approaches a developer with a licensed IP, the constraints conversation usually goes one of four ways:

·      他们已经知道他们希望你制作的游戏，了解游戏设计的基本原理，并提出了可信的建议。

·      They already know the game they want you to make, know the fundamentals of game design, and have made a credible suggestion.

·      他们已经知道了希望你制作的游戏，但对游戏设计的基本原理一无所知，并且提出了一款近乎可怕的游戏。

·      They already know the game they want you to make, have no idea about the fundamentals of game design, and have suggested a game that borders on horrifying.

·      他们已经知道希望你制作的游戏，就像最近的热门游戏一样，只是“更好”或“不同”。

·      They already know the game they want you to make, and it’s just like a recent hit, only “better” or “different.”

·      他们不知道自己想要做什么，并且依赖你告诉他们。

·      They have no idea what they want to make, and are relying on you to tell them.

严重地。

Seriously.

一旦相关知识产权被披露——无论是游戏续集、电影衍生品还是图书许可——设计师或设计师团队就需要在初次会议上提出正确的问题，以确定项目的约束条件（有关约束条件的更多信息，请参阅第 1 章“基础知识”）。解决了关键问题后，设计师还应该考虑其他问题

Once the IP in question has been disclosed—whether it’s a game sequel, a movie tie-in, or a book license—it’s up to the designer or team of designers to ask the right questions during that initial meeting to nail down the constraints for the project (See Chapter 1, “The Basics,” for more information on constraints). With the key questions out of the way, there are other questions that designers should

询问客户在使用授权 IP 时特别重要的一点：

ask their client that are particularly important when working with licensed IP:

·      这款游戏的目标受众是哪些人？

·      What is the target audience for the game?

·      游戏的期望评级是什么？（尽管游戏要等到制作接近尾声时才会被 ESRB 评级，但如果有的话，发行商心中都有一个理想的评级，并努力开发一款符合该评级的游戏。）

·      What is the desired rating for the game? (Although the game won’t be rated by the ESRB until it’s nearly finished with production, if at all, publishers have an ideal rating in mind and strive to develop a game to fit that rating.)

·      您心中有什么特定类型的游戏吗？

·      Do you have any particular genre or type of game in mind?

·      您希望在游戏中看到哪些功能？

·      Are there any features that you’d like to see in the game?

除了这些限制之外，每个知识产权可能都有自己的一套特定的行为准则。对于非常著名的知识产权角色，知识产权持有者通常会禁止或要求一系列行为。如果游戏涉及现实生活中的名人，则可能适用类似的规定。例如，名人可能不希望玩家对他们做他们看到的其他视频游戏角色所做的事情（例如被火箭发射器炸成碎片、从建筑物上摔下来、被汽车碾过、被困在房间里直到尿裤子等等）。

In addition to these constraints, each IP may have its own particular set of do’s and don’ts. For very famous IP characters, there is a whole set of behaviors that the IP holder routinely disallows or demands. If the game involves real-life celebrities, similar stipulations may apply. For instance, the celebrity might not want players doing to them what they’ve seen done to other video game characters (like being blown to bits by a rocket launcher, flung off a building, run over by a car, trapped in a room until they wet themselves, and so on).

同样，有时 IP 持有者可能不拥有使用我们通常认为是 IP 一部分的所有人的肖像的权利。例如，《星际迷航》归派拉蒙所有。但是，派拉蒙并不拥有演员的肖像。因此，至少一款《星际迷航》游戏的开发者必须从游戏中出现的每位演员那里获得权利。相反，WWE 职业摔跤团体拥有其动作、角色和其他一切的所有 IP 权利。因此，相同的开发者没有必要单独获得这些权利。

Similarly, sometimes an IP holder may not own the rights to use the likenesses of all the people that we commonly think of as part of the IP. For instance, Star Trek is owned by Paramount. However, Paramount doesn’t own the actors’ likenesses. As a result, developers of at least one Star Trek game had to secure the rights from each individual actor who appeared in the game. Conversely, the WWE pro wrestling group owns all the IP rights to its moves, personas, and everything else. So it was not necessary for the same developers to individually secure those rights.

最重要的是，开发者必须尊重知识产权，并决定在限制所留下的空间内，知识产权最适合哪个版本。以《爱探险的朵拉》这样的授权为例。知识产权本身就意味着某些限制——例如，一款针对儿童的 E 级游戏。知识产权持有者也不太可能欢迎一款角色被逐一碾压或被当作 FPS 中的炮灰的游戏。

Above all things, developers must honor the IP and decide where it fits best within the room left by the constraints. Consider a license like Dora the Explorer. The IP alone suggests certain constraints—an E-rated game targeted at children, for instance. It’s also highly unlikely that the IP holders would welcome a game in which the characters were run over one by one or put up as gun fodder in a FPS.

开发人员还希望了解之前有哪些具有相同 IP 的游戏（如果存在的话）。

Developers will also want to see what previous games bearing the same IP have been done, if any exist.

尊重球员

HONOR THE PLAYER

在讨论知识产权持有者、发行商和开发商对游戏有何期望时，不要忘记玩家。毕竟，游戏是为玩家而制作的。如果玩家不喜欢，就没有人会喜欢。问问自己和你的设计师同事，玩家对一款拥有你指定知识产权的游戏有何关键期望。

In all the talk of what the IP holder, publisher, and developer want from the game, don’t forget the player. After all, it’s who you’re making the game for. If the player doesn’t like it, no one will like it. Ask yourself and your fellow designers what key things the player expects from a game bearing your assigned IP.

如果您的游戏是关于迪士尼乐园的，玩家会期望看到什么和做什么？沃尔玛或海军陆战队怎么样？不同的 IP 会带来不同的期望。无论是大亨游戏还是大型多人 RPG，这些期望通常都是正确的。玩家在这些情况或地点会采取什么行动，玩家可以扮演什么角色？

If your game is about Disneyland, what will players expect to see and do? How about Wal*Mart or The Marines? Different IPs raise different expectations. These expectations generally hold true whether it’s a tycoon game or a massively multiplayer RPG. What actions would the player take in these situations or places, and what possible roles could the player play?

MDA 框架（可在线访问 http://algorithmancy.8kindsoffun.com）也为分析玩家的期望提供了很好的参考。IP 唤起的整体美感（或感觉）是什么？它有什么能唤起这种感觉？玩家在玩游戏时通常会期望有同样的感觉。如果电影让你害怕，游戏也应该让你害怕。

The MDA framework, available online at http://algorithmancy.8kindsoffun.com, also provides a great reference to analyze the player’s expectations. What is the overall aesthetic (or feeling) evoked by the IP? What about it evokes that feeling? Players will generally expect to feel the same when they play the game. If the movie scares you, so should the game.

游戏核心与 IP 核心

THE CORE OF THE GAME VERSUS THE CORE OF THE IP

和游戏一样，每个 IP 都有自己的核心，这也是 IP 营销部门想要传达的信息。然而，这个核心在电子游戏世界中可能不太适用。

Like games, every IP has its own core, which is the message that the marketing department of the IP wants to get across. However, that core may not translate so well into the video game world.

例如，经典获奖书籍《发条橙》就是一个 IP 。这本书包含大量性和暴力内容，而这两者都是该书主题的核心。如果将这一“核心”直接转移到电子游戏世界，该内容很可能会获得成人 (AO) 评级。

For instance, consider an IP like the classic and award-winning book A Clockwork Orange. The book contains an incredible amount of sex and violence, and both of these things are central to the theme of the book. This content would very likely earn it an Adults Only (AO) rating if that “core” were directly transferred to a video game world.

·       [游戏名称] 是关于极端暴力的。

·      [Game name] is about ultraviolence.

·       [游戏名称] 与性有关。

·      [Game name] is about sex.

·        [游戏名称] 是关于极端暴力和性的。

·       [Game name] is about ultraviolence and sex.

虽然可行，但不太可能盈利。大多数零售店都不会出售 AO 评级游戏。

While it’s workable, it’s not likely profitable. No AO-rated game would be sold in the great majority of retail stores.

因此，如果 IP 设计师无法将 IP 的核心完美地从一种媒介转换到另一种媒介，他们就需要找到一种方法来保留 IP 的意图。

So the IP’s designers need to find a way to preserve the intent of the IP if they are unable to translate its core perfectly from one medium to another.

挑战

CHALLENGES

IP。爱它、恨它、用它折磨别人。本章中的挑战旨在完善您灵活运用 IP 的能力。

IP. Love it, hate it, and torture others with it. The challenges in this chapter are meant to perfect your ability to work dexterously with IP.

挑战 1 — 爱心熊 IP

CHALLENGE 1—CARE BEARS IP

恭喜！您的开发团队已与 Hasbro 取得联系。他们计划通过主要媒体宣传来重振 Kenner 的爱心熊系列玩具，他们希望您的开发团队能够制作一款新视频游戏作为此次推广的一部分。

Congratulations! Your development team has been approached by Hasbro. They are planning on revitalizing Kenner’s Care Bears series of toys with major media promotions, and they want part of that rollout to be a new video game created by your development team.

他们想要一款能够回归授权起源的游戏：最初的 10 只熊。如果您的游戏成功了，那么后来添加的熊（以及 Care Bear Cousins）将保留用于续集。

They want a game that goes back to the origins of the license: the original 10 bears. The bears that were added later (and the Care Bear Cousins) will be reserved for sequels if your game is successful.

您的游戏概念应符合许可规定。例如，不得出现血腥或斩首场面。将其评级定为 E 级，适合所有人。

Your game concept should be true to the license. No blood or decapitation, for example. Keep it rated E for Everyone.

还有一个额外的限制：作为发布的一部分，孩之宝希望这款游戏的目标受众是男女幼童（以及怀旧的大孩子）。

One additional constraint: As part of the release, Hasbro wants the game to target young children (and nostalgic older children) of both genders.

所需组件

Components Required

·      用于研究的互联网连接

·      Internet connection for research

可交付成果

Deliverable

·      推介，至少包括以下内容：游戏类型或游戏玩法简介、主要游戏功能列表以及主要角色列表（可玩角色和反派，如果有）

·      Pitch, including at least the following: game genre or brief description of gameplay, list of major game features, and list of major characters (playable characters and villains, if any)

·      示例截图

·      Sample screenshot

建议流程

Suggested Process

1.    找出重要的例子。花点时间想想你玩过的哪些授权游戏非常好或非常糟糕。把它们分成两栏，像这样： 授权游戏 r0x0rz 授权游戏 糟糕游戏 特别注意使用相同许可证的游戏组，其中一些游戏很好，另一些游戏很差。突出显示这些组。

1.    Identify important examples. Take a moment to think about the licensed games that you have played that were either really good or really terrible. Write them down in two columns, like so: Licensed Games that r0x0rz Licensed Games that suxx0rz Pay particular attention to groups of games that use the same license, where some of those games were good and others were bad. Highlight those groups.

2.    确定设计规则。在列表中寻找常见的主题、趋势和模式。好游戏的哪些方面让它们能够以坏游戏无法实现的方式发挥作用？许可证的好用和坏用之间有什么区别？比较之后，您可能想要列出自己的许可证使用设计规则列表。

2.    Identify design rules. Look for common themes, trends, and patterns in your list. What is it about the good games that make them work in a way that the bad games just don’t? What is the difference between a good and bad use of a license? After comparing, you may want to come up with your own list of design rules when making use of a license.

3.    研究许可证。 了解 Care Bears 许可证。（因为你知道开发团队中没有人会承认自己是这方面的专家。）回答以下问题：许可证的吸引力是什么？你自己可能不喜欢它，但为什么这个 IP 的粉丝会喜欢它？列出主要角色并简要描述他们的特点。列出这个世界的“规则”——这个许可证中发生的事情与现实世界有什么不同，以及那里永远不会发生什么样的事情？

3.    Research the license. Learn about the Care Bears license. (Because you just know that no one else on your development team will admit to being a guru on the subject.) Answer the following questions: What is the appeal of the license? You may not like it yourself, but why would a fan of the IP like it? List the main characters and briefly describe their characteristics. List the “rules” of the world—what happens in this license that is different from the real world, and what kinds of things never happen there?

4.    研究市场。 了解目标市场的限制和需求。如果你的游戏是为 6 岁以下儿童开发的，那么阅读可能是不可能的。对于更小的孩子来说，使用控制器可能超出了他们的能力范围。

4.    Research the market. Learn about the limits and desires of your target market. If your game is to be developed for children under six, then reading is likely out of the question. For even younger kids, use of a controller might be beyond them.

5.    集思广益。以小组形式讨论可能的概念。

5.    Brainstorm. In a group, discuss potential concepts.

6.    创建可交付成果。

6.    Create deliverable.

 变体

 Variants

为研究和游戏设计挑战选择不同的许可证。选择一个你听说过的知识产权，但不知道它怎么会这么受欢迎。儿童许可证（尤其是与你性别相反的儿童）往往

Choose a different license for both the research and game-design challenges. Choose an IP that you have heard of, but do not understand how it could possibly be as popular as it is. Licenses for children (especially those of the opposite sex from you) tend

最具指导意义。选择一个好的 IP，比如一部获得奥斯卡奖但尚未被制作成视频游戏的老电影。选择你自己的目标市场和评级水平。

to be the most instructive. Choose a good IP, like an Academy Award–winning movie of old that’s yet to be made into a video game. Select your own target market and rating level.

挑战 2 — 添加 IP

CHALLENGE 2—ADD AN IP

大多数游戏开发者（尤其是设计师）都有一堆他们希望有朝一日能够实现的游戏概念。时不时地，他们会向发行商推销他们的一个概念，发行商会询问他们是否可以调整这个概念以适应特定的许可。为了应对这一挑战，您将假装 Clarence Darrow 从未存在过，Monopoly游戏从未发布过，而您只是突然想出了一个房地产游戏的创意。您已将这个概念推销给 Electronic Arts；他们很兴奋，但他们不认为这款游戏作为原创 IP 会有什么发展。幸运的是，他们刚刚获得了Dukes of Hazzard许可，他们要求您重新推销以纳入该许可。

Most game developers (especially designers) have a pile of game concepts that they would love to make some day. Every now and then, they get to pitch one of their concepts to a publisher that responds by asking if they can adapt the concept to fit a particular license. For the purposes of this challenge, you will pretend that Clarence Darrow never existed, that the game Monopoly was never published, and that you have just come up with an idea for a real-estate game. You have pitched the concept to Electronic Arts; they are excited, but they don’t see this game going anywhere as an original IP. Luckily, they have just secured the Dukes of Hazzard license, and they are asking you to redo your pitch to incorporate the license.

以经典棋盘游戏《大富翁》为例，对其进行修改以包含该许可证。同时建议对游戏规则进行至少一项修改，以使游戏更符合该许可证。

Take the classic board game Monopoly and change it to include this license. Also suggest at least one change to the game rules to make the game a better fit for the license.

所需组件

Components Required

·      一份《大富翁》 游戏以供参考（可选）

·      A copy of Monopoly for reference (optional)

·      需要网络连接才能查询许可证

·      An Internet connection to research the license

·      如果要制作功能性棋盘游戏，请准备一张海报板和 2d6

·      Sheet of posterboard and 2d6, if making a functional board game

可交付成果

Deliverable

·      原型级功能性棋盘游戏或

·      Prototype-level functional board game or

·      生产级功能性棋盘游戏

·      Production-grade functional board game

建议流程

Suggested Process

1.通读    大富翁游戏规则。注意： 请记住，大多数人玩这款游戏时都不会遵守其原始书面规则。免费停车的钱和停在“Go”上的双倍钱都是对原版大富翁游戏的修改，顺便说一句，原版大富翁游戏本身就是一个修改版。同样，几乎没有人使用拍卖机制，如果有人在停在某块土地上时拒绝购买，该机制就会生效。

1.    Read over the rules to Monopoly. Note: Keep in mind that most people do not play this game by its original written rules. Money on free parking and double money for landing on “Go” are all mods to the original Monopoly, which was, by the way, a mod in itself. Similarly, almost no one employs the auction mechanic, which comes into effect if someone refuses to buy property when he lands on it.

2.    研究许可证（参考挑战1，步骤3）。

2.    Research the license (refer to Challenge 1, step3).

3.    研究市场（参见挑战 1，步骤 4）。记住要尊重玩家，并包括他们希望看到的功能、个人和设置。

3.    Research the market (refer to Challenge1, step 4). Remember to honor the player and include the features, individuals, and settings they’d hope to see.

4.    集思广益。《正义前锋》是一款有趣的授权游戏，拥有许多酷炫的游戏玩法可能性。想想如果你在玩这款游戏，你希望可以做的事情，并列出这些行动。在小组中讨论游戏核心与授权核心之间的相似之处和不同之处。此外，讨论游戏规则的变化以增加相似性。

4.    Brainstorm. Dukes of Hazzard is a fun license with lots of possibilities for cool gameplay. Think of the things you wish you could do if you were playing the game, and make a list of these actions. In a group, discuss the similarities and differences between the core of the game and the core of the license. Also, discuss changes in the game rules to increase the similarity.

5.    创建可交付成果。

5.    Create deliverable.

变体

Variants

使用不同的原创游戏，如《卡卡颂》或其他许可证。如果以小组形式进行，为对方小组选择随机许可证和随机游戏会很有趣，有时也意味着要随机选择。

Use a different original game, like Carcassonne, or a different license. If working in groups, it’s fun and occasionally mean to select a random license and a random game for the opposing group.

将您对游戏的实际想法应用到非数字游戏或现有非数字游戏的模型中。

Take an idea that you actually have for a game and apply it to a non-digital game or a mod of an existing non-digital game.

挑战 3 — 寻找 IP

CHALLENGE 3—FIND THE IP

有时，为了让游戏概念在宣传中更吸引发行商，设计师会决定提出合适的许可。例如，一款讲述人们被困在岛上挣扎求生的游戏可以改编为电视剧《吉利根岛》、《迷失》和《幸存者》，甚至是电影《荒岛余生》。

Occasionally, to make a game concept more appealing to a publisher in a pitch, a designer decides to propose a suitable license. For instance, a game about people stuck on an island struggling to survive could adapt itself to the television shows Gilligan’s Island, LOST, and Survivor, or even the movie Castaway.

对于这个挑战，请选择一款原创 IP 游戏（可以是数字游戏或棋盘游戏），并对其进行修改，使其准确反映另一个流行的 IP。例如，考虑星际迷航版的卡卡颂或变形金刚 版的Risk。事实上，后者确实被创建了，其他著名 IP 版本的RISK也是如此。理想情况下，找到一个不需要对游戏玩法进行重大更改或看起来与游戏格格不入的许可证。回到之前的挑战，Care Bears版的Risk似乎不太可能。

For this challenge, choose a game (this can be either a digital game or a board game) that is an original IP and modify it so that it accurately reflects another popular IP. For instance, consider a Star Trek version of Carcassonne or a Transformers version of Risk. In fact, the latter was actually created, as were other famous IP versions of RISK. Ideally, find a license that would not require significant changes to gameplay or seem an odd fit for the game. Going back to a previous challenge, a Care Bears version of Risk seems unlikely.

所需组件

Components Required

·      互联网连接以研究建议的 IP（可选）

·      Internet connection to research proposed IP (optional)

·      将发现的 IP 应用于棋盘游戏

·      Board game to apply found IP to

·      原型游戏的组件

·      Components for a prototype game

可交付成果

Deliverable

·      任何媒介的原型游戏

·      Prototype game of any medium

建议流程

Suggested Process

1.    决定游戏。 选择一款你目前喜欢玩的非数字游戏。可以是任何游戏，只要是非数字的即可。不过，建议你不要选择Risk，因为我们已经在这个挑战中大量使用了它。

1.    Decide on a game. Select a non-digital game that you currently enjoy playing. It can be any game at all, so long as it is non-digital. It’s recommended that you don’t select Risk, though, since we’ve used it heavily in this challenge already.

2.    集思广益，寻找可能的 IP。考虑可能适合第 1 步所选游戏的 IP。这有助于确定游戏的核心动态，然后搜索具有类似核心动态的 IP。如果您游戏中的动态是关于冒险探索新领域，那么它可能非常适合《星球大战》或《太空堡垒卡拉狄加》甚至《Ice Road Truckers》。

2.    Brainstorm possible IPs. Consider IPs that might be a fit for the game selected in step 1. It helps to identify the core dynamic of the game and then search for IPs with similar core dynamics. If the dynamic in your game is about exploring new territory with risk, it might be a good fit for Star Wars or Battlestar Galactica or even Ice Road Truckers.

3.    研究许可证（参见挑战 1，步骤 3）。记住要尊重玩家，并包括他们希望看到的功能、个人和设置。

3.    Research the license (refer to Challenge 1, step 3). Remember to honor the player and include the features, individuals, and settings they’d hope to see.

4.    创建可交付成果。

4.    Create deliverable.

挑战4——莎士比亚

CHALLENGE 4—SHAKESPEARE

有些游戏利用了已经属于公共领域的大量知识产权。通常，这些知识产权的形式是古罗马、希腊或日本神话，但我们的设计范围不必局限于这些。较新的公共领域作品具有巨大的潜力，这些作品甚至还没有开始在游戏媒介中得到探索。

Some games take advantage of the vast pool of IP that is already in the public domain. Usually, this is in the form of ancient Roman, Greek, or Japanese mythology, but there is no need to limit the range of our designs to these. There is vast potential in more recent public domain works that have not even begun to be explored in the medium of games.

在本练习中，您将根据莎士比亚的任何一部戏剧创建一个游戏概念。当然，熟悉该戏剧对创建概念有很大帮助。

For this exercise, you will create a game concept based on any Shakespearean play. Naturally, familiarity with said play will be of great help in creating a concept.

所需组件

Components Required

·      用于研究的互联网连接

·      Internet connection for research

·      原型游戏的组件

·      Components for prototype game

·      莎士比亚戏剧

·      Shakespearian play

可交付成果

Deliverable

·      原型棋盘游戏或

·      Prototype board game or

·      宣传一款数字游戏

·      Pitch for a digital game

建议流程

Suggested Process

1.    决定一部戏剧。 选择一部你熟悉或你感兴趣的戏剧。如果你和莎士比亚已经很久没有在一起了，维基百科会提供他每部戏剧的简要概述。选择一个适合你想要的难度级别的戏剧。

1.    Decide on a play. Select a play that you’re familiar with or that seems interesting to you. If it’s been a long, long time since you and the Bard spent anytime together, Wikipedia provides quick summaries of each of his plays. Select one that feels like a good fit for your desired difficulty level.

2.    集思广益，想出各种可行的方法。如何将莎士比亚的作品融入游戏形式完全取决于你。你会像克尼齐亚在《指环王》中所做的那样，尝试遵循主要情节及其营造的感觉吗？你会专注于故事的一个小部分，比如罗密欧与朱丽叶想要在一起的愿望，或者他们的父母想要阻止他们？你会选择一个独特的视角，比如一个富有同情心的警卫的视角吗？不管最初看起来有多难，等到你找到一个真正吸引你的观点。

2.    Brainstorm possible approaches. How you implement Shakespeare’s work into game form is entirely up to you. Will you try to follow the major acts and the feeling it creates as Knizia did with Lord of the Rings? Will you focus on a small component of the story, like Romeo and Juliet’s desire to be together or their parents’ desire to stop them? Will you perhaps select a unique viewpoint, like that of a sympathetic guard? Wait until you get one that really appeals to you, no matter how difficult it initially seems.

3.    仔细考虑机制和功能。从游戏玩法的角度来看，您的方法究竟如何发挥作用？如果您打算创建宣传可交付成果，请考虑玩家在游戏中期望的功能。如果您正在创建棋盘游戏，玩家将能够执行哪些操作？是什么阻碍了他们？考虑您的方法与各种动态，例如领土获取或竞相冲刺。

3.    Mull mechanics and features. Exactly how would your approach work from a gameplay perspective? If you’re planning to create the pitch deliverable, consider the features that a player would expect in the game. If you’re creating a board game, what actions will the player be able to perform? What’s standing in their way? Consider your approach versus various dynamics such as territorial acquisition or race to the end.

4.    创建可交付成果。 宣传应包括以下内容：

4.    Create deliverable. A pitch should include the following:

·      游戏剧情简介

·      Brief summary of the game’s storyline

·      游戏类型或玩法简介

·      Game genre or brief description of gameplay

·      游戏主要特色列表

·      List of major game features

·      主要角色列表（可玩角色和反派角色，如果有的话）

·      List of major characters (playable characters and villains, if any)

变体

Variants

使用不同的公共领域 IP。考虑文艺复兴时期的艺术家及其作品；很久以前已故的著名人物，如 Brian Boru、Strongbow 和爱尔兰海盗 Mary Reid；广为庆祝的宗教节日；以及具有重要历史意义的著名建筑（例如伦敦塔）。过去确实充满了等待出现的电子游戏和许多人已经知道的优秀 IP。

Use a different public-domain IP. Consider Renaissance artists and their works; famous deceased people of long ago like Brian Boru, Strongbow, and Mary Reid, an Irish pirate; widely celebrated religious holidays; and famous buildings with significant history (for example, the Tower of London). The past is literally filled with video games waiting to happen and excellent IPs that many, many people already know.

挑战 5 — 铁艺设计师挑战赛（现场直播）

CHALLENGE 5—IRON DESIGNER CHALLENGE (LIVE)

如果您已经完成过一两个 IP 挑战，那么 Iron Designer Challenge 是一个值得挑战的绝佳项目。IDC 让您思考潜在的 IP 并探索您之前未曾考虑过的可能性。这项挑战至少需要两支个人团队。

With an IP challenge or two under your belt, the Iron Designer Challenge is an excellent project to take on. The IDC gets you thinking about potential IPs and exploring possibilities you hadn’t previously considered. This challenge will require at least two teams of individuals.

对于这个挑战，请在白板或纸上将数字 1-6 分成两栏。对于其中一栏，请人们向您提供制作成游戏会极具挑战性的 IP。接下来，对于另一栏，请人们向您提供可以制作出优秀游戏但由于某种原因尚未制作成游戏的 IP。

For this challenge, write the numbers 1-6 in two columns on a whiteboard or a piece of paper. For one column, ask people to provide you with IPs that would be phenomenally challenging to make into a game. Next, for the other column, ask people to provide you with IPs that would make excellent games, but have not yet been made into a game for one reason or another.

通常，列表如下所示： 

Typically, the list looks something like this: 

挑战知识产权

Challenging IP

1.Radio Shack（无线电小屋）

1. Radio Shack

2.《哈泼斯杂志》

2. Harper’s Magazine

3.帕丽斯·希尔顿

3. Paris Hilton

4. Eggo 华夫饼

4. Eggo Waffles

5. 美国有线电视新闻网

5. CNN

6.美国邮政服务

6. U.S. Postal Service

好IP

Good IP

1. 惊魂记

1. Psycho

2.低俗小说

2. Pulp Fiction

3.空军

3. Air Force

4. [当前热门电视节目]

4. [Current Popular TV Show]

5. [当前热门电影]

5. [Current Popular Movie]

6.塞缪尔·杰克逊 

6. Samuel L. Jackson  

毫无疑问，这些 IP 都是有价值的，而且具有可识别性。然而，右栏中的 IP 似乎对普通设计师来说更能带来更好的游戏。如果你发现人们很难想出好点子或坏点子，那就开始提出你自己的好点子和坏点子吧。这几乎总能让他们动起来。

Each of these IPs is undoubtedly valuable and recognizable. However, the IPs in the right column seem to suggest better games to the average designer. If you find that people are having a difficult time coming up with good or bad ideas, start putting up your own bad and good ideas. That almost always gets them moving.

创建列表后，每个团队都会掷骰子。掷出 1-3 的团队将进入挑战列表。掷出 4-6 的团队将进入好名单。接下来，他们掷骰子来确定他们获得哪个 IP。这个过程很有趣，有时也很可怕，尤其是对那些最终进入挑战列表的团队来说。

Once your list is created, each team rolls a die. Teams that roll 1-3 get on the challenging list. Teams that roll a 4-6 get on the good list. Next, they roll a die to determine which IP they get. The process is fun and occasionally terrifying, particularly to those teams who end up on the challenging list.

所需组件

Components Required

·      用于研究的互联网连接

·      Internet connection for research

·       1d6

·      1d6

可交付成果

Deliverable

·      沥青

·      Pitch

建议流程

Suggested Process

1.    接受和研究。当获得一个知识产权，特别是一个具有挑战性的知识产权时，一些设计师会感到束手无策。他们说：“我应该如何处理 Radio Shack 的授权？”此时，重要的是要考虑电子游戏的全部范围。游戏远不止最新的游戏机热销产品。Radio Shack 的知识产权可以很容易地用于创建训练游戏或 ARG 来宣传新店的开业，或广告游戏来宣传商店多样化的电子元件系列。所以，考虑范围，并做好研究。通过研究主题，您可能会发现有关知识产权的一些东西，它们很容易融入电子游戏世界。

1.    Acceptance and research. When awarded an IP, particularly a challenging IP, some designers feel stuck. “What am I supposed to do with the Radio Shack license?” they say. It’s important at this point to think of the full range of video games. Games are much more than the latest console hit. The Radio Shack IP could easily be used to create a training game or an ARG to promote a new store’s opening or an advergame to promote the store’s diverse collection of electronic components. So, think range, and do your research. By researching topics, you may find things out about the IP that easily shape themselves to a video game world.

2.    探索游戏类型。 从各种角度探索 IP。将其想象成一款严肃游戏、一款休闲游戏、一款 FPS 或一款 RPG。除了开阔眼界，它几乎总是值得一笑，因为有些 IP 并不适合某些游戏类型。决定游戏类型。

2.    Explore the genres. Explore the IP from a variety of viewpoints. Imagine it as a serious game, a casual game, an FPS, or an RPG. In addition to opening your eyes to the possibilities, it’s almost always worth a laugh, since some IPs are horrible fits for some genres. Decide on the genre.

3.    创建功能集。在考虑 IP 和类型的同时，还要考虑类型和 IP 持有者的要求。虽然某些 IP 在被强行纳入特定功能集时可能看起来特别有趣，但 IP 持有者不太可能批准这样的列表。以接受挑战的精神接受挑战 — 尝试利用你得到的机会真正制作出一款好游戏。

3.    Create a feature set. With both IP and genre in mind, consider the requirements of the genre, as well as that of the IP holder. While certain IPs might seem to be particularly funny when manhandled into a particular feature set, the IP holder is unlikely to approve such a list. Take the challenge in the spirit in which it is offered—try to actually make a good game out of the hand you’ve been dealt.

4.    创建可交付成果。 推介应包括以下内容：

4.    Create deliverable. The pitch should include the following:

a.     游戏剧情简介

a.     Brief summary of the game’s storyline

b.    游戏类型或玩法简介

b.    Game genre or brief description of gameplay

c.     游戏主要特色列表

c.     List of major game features

d.    主要角色列表（可玩角色和反派，如果有的话）

d.    List of major characters (playable characters and villains, if any)

变体

Variants

要求每个团队或个人想出最糟糕的 IP。当每个人都做出决定后，告诉他们挑选一个人来接收不受欢迎的 IP。该团队或个人必须想出一个可能的设计。

Ask each team or individual to think of the worst IP possible. When everyone’s decided, tell them to pick someone to receive the undesirable IP. That team or individual must come up with a possible design.

非数字短片

NON-DIGITAL SHORTS

以下列表包含棋盘游戏、纸牌游戏或其他不含数字游戏组件的游戏的创意。它们鼓励您以非数字格式探索非常动态的概念。它们是非数字设计练习的理想选择。

The following list contains ideas for board games, card games, or other games that are free of a digital game component. They encourage you to explore very dynamic concepts in a non-digital format. They are ideal for a non-digital design exercise.

1.    围绕你的一项与游戏无关的爱好设计一款纸牌游戏，并使用该爱好领域的知名 IP。

1.    Design a card game based around one of your non-game-related hobbies that uses a well-known IP within that hobby.

2.    为您参与的活动或组织设计广告游戏。

2.    Design an advergame for an activity or organization in which you participate.

3.    目标受众是任何 IP 的关键部分。以一个成熟的 IP（如《法律与秩序》）为例，设计一款基于该 IP 的游戏，但目标受众为 6 至 8 岁的儿童。

3.    The target audience is a critical part of any IP. Take an otherwise mature IP, such as Law & Order, and design a game based on it but targeted to children age six to eight.

4.    选择您已从本书的挑战中创建的设计，并在不改变核心机制的情况下为其添加 IP。但是，您可以向其中添加其他机制。

4.    Choose a design you have already created from a challenge in this book and add an IP to it without changing the core mechanic. You may add other mechanics to it, however.

5.    选择一款经典的纸牌游戏，比如《黑桃》，为其创造一个IP；然后基于该IP设计游戏的续集。

5.    Choose a classic card game like Spades and invent an IP for it; then design a sequel to the game based on that IP.

6.    从电子游戏中选择一个基于 IP 的棋盘游戏并为其设计扩展。

6.    Choose a board game based on IP from a video game and design an expansion for it.

7.    优秀的 IP 会定期根据其内容催生出新的 IP — 电视“衍生”节目就是例子。为您最喜欢的视频游戏 IP 之一创作一个衍生作品，并根据它设计一款棋盘游戏。

7.    Exceptional IPs regularly spawn new IPs based on their content—TV “spinoff” shows are examples of this. Invent a spinoff for one of your favorite video-game IPs and design a board game based on it.

8.    使用 IP 的关键在于确保权利。想象一下，你获得了一部知名电影的 IP 来制作一款棋盘游戏，但你无法获得主角肖像权。在设计棋盘游戏时，请考虑到这一限制。

8.    Using IPs is all about securing rights. Imagine you’re given the IP of a well-known film to make a board game, but you were unable to secure the rights to the lead actor’s likeness. Design the board game with that limitation.

9.    作为前述方法的替代方案，选择一个基于 IP 的现有棋盘游戏或纸牌游戏，并重新设计它，去掉 IP 的一些关键元素，例如主要设置、角色或标志性动作。

9.    As an alternative to the preceding, choose an existing board or card game based on IP and redesign it without some critical element of the IP, such as a major setting, character, or signature move.

10. 从西方电视节目或电影中选择一个著名角色，并根据该角色创建一个游戏。

10. Select a famous character from a western TV show or film and create a game based on this character.



 

 

10：创作续集

10: Creating Sequels

您在大型零售店中能找到的不仅仅是授权 IP。您还可以找到授权 IP 的续集！

Licensed IPs aren’t the only thing you’ll find in major retail stores. You’ll also find sequels to licensed IPs!

成功、中等成功甚至有时非常糟糕的游戏的续集是游戏行业（以及许多其他行业）的主流。虽然玩家们抱怨续集的存在，称当今的电子游戏缺乏创新或原创机制，但出版商仍然订购、发货和销售续集，这有一个很好的理由：因为玩家会购买，不管他们怎么说。

Sequels to successful, moderately successful, and sometimes downright awful games are a staple of the game industry (and many other industries, for that matter). While players bemoan their very existence, saying that there’s no innovation or original mechanics in today’s video games, there’s a very good reason why publishers still order, ship, and sell sequels: because gamers buy them, no matter what they say.

DoubleFine Productions 出品的《精神航海家》是一款极具创新性的作品。 《块魂》也是如此。这两款产品都被誉为“黑马”，这是礼貌的说法，“它们应该卖得更好。”当然，后者最终推出了续集。

Psychonauts by DoubleFine Productions was an incredibly innovative title. So was Katamari Damacy. Both products were praised as “sleeper hits,” the polite way of saying, “They should have sold more.” The latter, of course, eventually produced a sequel.

为什么要拍续集？

WHY SEQUELS?

与知识产权一样，发行商和开发商发行续集是为了降低风险。不过，续集对开发商来说还有一些额外的好处，而游戏行业以外的人可能并不会立即意识到这一点。为了便于讨论，我们假设我们正在讨论一款名为Bazooka Bomb的游戏（对于游戏来说，这是一个糟糕的名字，所以请随意盗用它）。

As with IP, publishers and developers publish sequels to mitigate risk. With sequels, though, there are a few additional benefits to a developer that may not be immediately obvious to someone not in the game industry. For the sake of discussion, let’s say that we’re talking about a game called Bazooka Bomb (which is a terrible name for a game, so feel free to steal it).

我们可以做得更好

WE CAN MAKE IT BETTER

随着原版《Bazooka Bomb》的发布，开发者们取得了不错的成绩。发行商对此很满意，游戏也赚回了预付款，甚至开始支付一些版税。游戏论坛上开始出现一些帖子，称赞某些功能，抱怨其他功能，并希望有更多功能。所有这些都为开发者提供了续集的灵感。

With the release of the original Bazooka Bomb, the developers did reasonably well. The publisher was pleased, and the game earned out its advance and even began to pay a few royalties. Posts have started appearing on game forums complimenting particular features, complaining about others, and wishing still more features were there. All of this gives developers ideas for the sequel.

在您认为这是您从事游戏设计职业的必经之路之前，请放心，事实并非如此。开发人员在这些论坛上获得的想法很可能只会验证他们已有的知识，或提出他们需要找到设计解决方案的问题。开发人员从评论者、批判性分析（一个新兴领域）和粉丝论坛收集的信息只是谜题的一部分。如果他们有时间这样做，他们很可能至少有 10 个东西想在游戏中加入。

Before you go thinking that this is the surefire road to your career in game design, rest assured it’s not. The ideas developers get on these boards will, more than likely, only validate the knowledge they already have, or raise issues to which they need to find design solutions. Information that developers collect from reviewers, critical analysis (an emerging field), and fan forums is only a part of the puzzle. Odds are, there were at least 10 things they wanted to get in the game if only they’d had time to do so.

掌握了所有这些知识（至少制作过一次游戏，并且进行了一次大规模的付费游戏测试），开发人员完全有能力让下一款游戏比之前更好，尤其是考虑到他们收到的所有反馈。他们知道什么可行，什么不可行。

With all this knowledge in hand—having created the game at least once and run, in essence, an enormous pay-for-play focus test—the developers are well equipped to make the next game even better than the one before, particularly given all the feedback they’ve received. They know what works, and they know what doesn’t.

每部出色的续集，比如从《最终幻想 VI》到《最终幻想 VII》，通常都会有一部续集失败。获奖作品《幽浮：深海恐怖》之后是略带悲剧色彩的《幽浮执法者》，有人说这款游戏破坏了前作的所有优点。有时，续集会比启发它的游戏更好。想想《魔兽争霸 2：黑暗之潮》、《洛克人 2》和《街头霸王 2》等游戏。大多数人从未听说过这一系列的原版游戏，至少在玩过“热门”续集之后才知道。

For every great sequel iteration out there, like Final Fantasy VI to Final Fantasy VII, there’s usually a sequel gone wrong as well. X-Com: Terror from the Deep, an award-winning title, was followed up by the somewhat tragic X-Com Enforcer, a game that some say broke all the good things about its predecessor. Other times, the sequel can be better than the game that inspired it. Consider games like Warcraft 2: Tides of Darkness, Mega Man 2, and Street Fighter 2. Most people had never heard of the original games in these series, at least not until after they’d played the “hit” sequel.

我们拥有技术

WE HAVE THE TECHNOLOGY

续集的另一个好处是技术成熟，特别是如果它是特定一代游戏机上系列的第二款或第三款游戏。保存和加载、战斗、网络、引擎速度等可能会得到改进——有时甚至会得到显著改进——但从稳定的代码库开始的好处不容小觑。

Another benefit of sequels is proven technology, particularly if it’s a second or third game in a series on a particular generation of consoles. Things like saving and loading, combat, networking, engine speed, and the like may be improved—sometimes dramatically—but the benefit of starting with a stable code base can’t be understated.

因此，后续作品之间共享技术不仅可以节省时间，还可以节省金钱。

So, sequels that share technology sequel-to-sequel save not only time, but money, too.

不过，有时续集并不会共享技术。在 20 世纪 90 年代，许多长期游戏系列从 2D 世界转变为 3D 平铺世界，再转变为全 3D 平滑滚动世界。在当时的行业中，听到某款游戏“从头开始开发”并不罕见。这不是一项功能，而是一项必需品。

Sometimes, sequels don’t share technology, though. During the 1990s, many longstanding game series made the switch from 2D worlds to 3D tile-based worlds to full 3D smooth scrolling worlds. In the industry at that time, it was not uncommon to hear that a particular game had been “developed from the ground up.” It wasn’t a feature—it was a necessity.

我们甚至可能拥有内容

WE MAY EVEN HAVE THE CONTENT

我们的游戏示例Bazooka Bomb失去了一名关卡设计师，转投了另一家公司。结果，团队花了比预期多三个月的时间才完成项目，而且他们交付的关卡也比预期少了三个。虽然这当然不是理想的情况，但游戏设计是可扩展的，玩家并没有注意到最终结果。如果你目前最喜欢的基于关卡的游戏中应该有三个关卡，你怎么知道呢？

Our game example, Bazooka Bomb, has lost one of its level designers to another company. As a result, it took the team three months longer to finish the project than expected, and they also delivered it three levels short of what they’d intended. While it certainly wasn’t an ideal situation, the game design was scalable, and the net result wasn’t noticed by players. If there were supposed to be three more levels in your current favorite level-based game, how would you know?

关卡设计全部完成，但关卡设计师的离去导致设计未能完美。游戏中经常发生类似的事情——叙事潜力未能实现、艺术资产已创建但未实现，以及可能仍有潜力的功能被删减，只要以略微不同的方式完成或投入稍多的开发时间即可。

The designs for the levels had all been completed, but the loss of the level designer left them unpolished. Similar things happen all the time in games—narrative potential that wasn’t realized, art assets that were created but not implemented, and cut features that might still have potential, if only they were done a slightly different way or could have slightly more development time devoted to them.

该内容有可能被用于续集或扩展包，本节后面会介绍。

This content has the potential to be used in a sequel or an expansion pack, covered later in this section.

续集类型

TYPES OF SEQUELS

尽管“续集”一词在游戏行业中的使用相对宽泛，但实际上存在不同类型的续集。

Although the term “sequel” is used relatively loosely in the game industry, there are actually different kinds of sequels.

扩展包

EXPANSION PACKS

扩展包要求玩家拥有续集的原版游戏，旨在扩展原版游戏体验。它们通常包含额外的故事、任务和探索，以及新武器和 NPC。游戏《魔兽世界：燃烧的远征》是 MMO 游戏《魔兽世界》的扩展。

Expansion packs require the player to own the original game from which the sequel came and are designed to expand upon the original play experience. They frequently contain additional narrative, missions, and quests, as well as new weapons and NPCs. The game World of Warcraft: The Burning Crusade was an expansion for the MMO World of Warcraft.

多模态性

MODS

模组通常以新关卡、新任务和新物品的形式出现。虽然将模组称为“续集”有点牵强，但它们或多或少都是外部团队制作的扩展包。《反恐精英》 可以说是最著名的模组，由两名大学生制作。

Mods usually take the form of new levels, new missions, and new items. While it’s a stretch to call mods “sequels,” they are more or less expansion packs made by external groups. Counterstrike is arguably the most famous mod, and was created by two college students.

续集

SEQUELS

当人们提到“续集”时，他们通常指的是开箱即​​用的独立产品，无需额外软件即可玩。有时，这些游戏允许您从以前的游戏中导入角色，或加载系列中前一款游戏中的保存游戏。完整的续集可能与它们所基于的游戏相似，或者设计师可能只保留了名称，而改变了大部分内容。

When people refer to a “sequel,” they are usually referring to stand-alone products that are good to go right out of the box and require no additional software to play. Sometimes, these games allow you to import your character from previous games or to load in your saved game from the previous game in the series. Full sequels may resemble the game upon which they are based, or the designers may have kept the name only, changing much of what was under the hood.

每年发布

YEARLY RELEASES

就像时钟一样，这些游戏都具有相同的基本玩法和能力，但游戏充满了新内容。《Madden》系列是年度游戏的完美典范。虽然与扩展包类似，但年度发行不需要拥有任何之前的游戏即可玩。

Like clockwork, these games ship with the same basic play set and abilities, but fill the game with new content. The Madden series is a perfect example of a yearly game. While similar to expansion packs, yearly releases don’t require ownership of any previous game to play.

精神继承者

SPIRITUAL SUCCESSORS

精神续作并不是真正的续作，但由于各种原因，游戏玩家和开发者对其给予了特殊认可。例如，它们可能是由之前合作开发过一款游戏的同一个团队开发的，但无法使用原有的知识产权。独立游戏《激光小队复仇女神》通常被称为《X-Com》的精神续作，事实上，它是由同一支开发团队制作的。

Spiritual successors are not truly sequels, but are given special recognition among game players and developers for various reasons. For instance, they may be developed by the same group that worked on a previous game together, but with no access to the IP. The indie game Laser Squad Nemesis is often called the spiritual successor to X-Com and is, in fact, made by the same team of developers.

克隆

CLONES

 “让它看起来就像伊甸园一样，只不过增加了‘实时’模式。还有两条蛇。还有一个更大的苹果。”

 “Make it just like the Garden of Eden, only with a ‘live’ mode. And two snakes. And a bigger apple.”

每当游戏行业出现技术或玩法飞跃并带来可观的销量时，你大可放心，某个地方的营销部门也在要求同样的东西，只是有所不同，而且更好。在游戏行业，我们（有点嘲讽地）将这些游戏称为“克隆”。它们不是游戏的真正续集，但旨在针对相同的受众，并希望取得与最初启发克隆的游戏相同的成功。像Myst、 Doom、Ultima Online和Grand Theft Auto 3（将该系列带入 3D 时代）这样的老游戏让各地的营销部门都要求一些能够针对相同受众的游戏。

Whenever a technological or gameplay leap occurs in the game industry that results in significant sales, you can rest assured that some marketing department somewhere is asking for the same thing, only different and better. In the game industry, we (somewhat derisively) call these games “clones.” They’re not true sequels to a game, but are designed to target the same audience and hopefully achieve the same success as the title that inspired the clone in the first place. Older games like Myst, Doom, Ultima Online, and Grand Theft Auto 3 (which moved the series into 3D) made marketing departments everywhere ask for something that would target the same audience.

制作续集

WORKING ON SEQUELS
