从某些方面来看，为成功游戏开发续集对设计师来说比开发全新产品要容易得多。游戏的核心已经成型，功能也受到了公众的广泛批评。与此同时，为热门游戏开发续集可能是一项艰巨的任务。玩家的期望很高，粉丝忠诚度很高，事情可能顺利，也可能失败。

Working on sequels to successful games is, in some respects, easier for designers than working on a brand new product. A solid core is already there, and the feature set has been critiqued by the public at large. At the same time, working on the sequel to a popular game can be daunting. Expectations are high, the fans are loyal, and things can go wrong just as easily as they can go right.

在制作续集时，成功的设计模式有四个：

In working with sequels, the pattern to successful design is fourfold:

·      利用：了解原版游戏的优点，不要把它搞砸。

·      Exploit: Know what made the original game good, and don’t screw it up.

·      扩展：改进游戏中的许多功能，检查每个功能以确保它仍然在某种程度上加强了游戏的核心。

·      Expand: Improve upon many of the features in the game, checking each to make sure that it still strengthens the core of the game in some way.

·      探索：与您的游戏相比，全面调查该类型游戏，并尝试以某种方式进行创新 - 无论是在线功能还是新的游戏模式，例如合作。

·      Explore: Survey the genre overall as compared to your game and try to innovate in some way—be it an online feature or a new play mode such as co-op.

·      消除：如果某些功能削弱了游戏的核心，或者削弱了增强游戏核心的功能，请将其删除。如果玩家讨厌它，那么可以肯定的是，它也应该被删除。

·      Exterminate: If there are features that make the game’s core weaker or detract from features that make the game core stronger, remove them. If your players hate it, it’s a safe bet that it should go, too.

这是对续集游戏设计的一种简单看法，讨论可能需要数周时间才能决定哪些需要实现、哪些需要保留或哪些需要完全删除。尽管如此，设计师通常都会遵循这一框架。

This is a simplistic view of sequel game design, and discussions can go back and forth for weeks deciding what needs to be implemented, left alone, or ripped out entirely. Nonetheless, this framework is generally the one that designers follow.

与任何游戏设计一样，限制也是因素之一。如果你有三个月的时间来制作续集，那么删除垃圾并添加一些新内容可能是你能做的最好的事情。（信不信由你，一些续集的开发时间只有三个月。）

As with any game design, constraints also factor in. If you have three months to make the sequel, getting the garbage out and adding in some new content may be the best you can do. (Believe it or not, some sequels have had three-month development times.)

以下是续集中的一些常见限制：

Here are some common constraints in a sequel:

·      关注故事：一些续集除了游戏风格之外，还承担着延续详细叙事的额外责任。在 CRPG 的鼎盛时期，故事有时会跨越五、六或七款游戏。对于巫术系列来说，仅分析故事、所有未解决的问题和潜在未来路径的文档就超过 70 页。该系列跨越 20 年，共推出 9 款游戏，其中包括两部三部曲。

·      Minding the story: Some sequels have an added responsibility of carrying on a detailed narrative in addition to a style of gameplay. In the heydays of CRPGs, stories sometimes carried across five, six, or seven games. For the Wizardry series, the document that analyzed the story, all its loose ends, and potential future paths was over 70 pages alone. The series spanned 20 years and nine games with two trilogies among them.

·      旧有新意：发行商有时会将续集外包给其他开发团队。例如，Harmonix 参与了前两部《吉他英雄》游戏的开发，而《吉他英雄 III》则由 Neversoft 开发。这在业内并不罕见。在这种情况下，尽管游戏可能相当熟悉，但其设计和技术可能并不熟悉。

·      When what’s old is new: Publishers sometimes farm out sequels to other development teams to work on. For instance, while Harmonix worked on the first two Guitar Hero games, Guitar Hero III was developed by Neversoft. It’s not uncommon in the industry at all. In cases like this, although the game may be quite familiar, its design and technology might not be.

向球员致敬

HONORING THE PLAYER

玩家期望是每款游戏设计中的一个因素。设计师必须仔细考虑玩家将在他们的游戏中体验、感受和学习什么，并弄清楚究竟哪些机制组合可以实现这些期望。当玩家已经对游戏是什么以及游戏应该是什么有了先入为主的观念时，它就成为团队必须特别关注的事情。

Player expectation factors into every game design. Designers must think through what players will experience, feel, and learn from their game-to-be and figure out exactly what combination of mechanics can deliver that. When players already have a preconceived notion about what the game is and, furthermore, what the game should be, it becomes something the team must devote exceptional attention to.

这就是为什么研究对于续集开发如此重要。

This is why research is so important in sequel development.

研究

RESEARCH

有多种方式可以监控粉丝和评论家对系列前几款游戏的反应。当然，你可以直接在 Google 上搜索游戏名称，但这样只会给你一大堆反应，首先是游戏的官方网站。在官方网站上，你不太可能看到“这是有史以来最糟糕的游戏，应该被埋没”。毕竟，该网站旨在推销游戏，而不是让人们远离它。

There are multiple ways to monitor fan and critical reaction to previous games in a series. One could, of course, just Google the game’s name, but that’s just going to give you a massive list of reactions, starting with the game’s official site. At that official site, you’re unlikely to find, “This is the worst game ever made and should be buried.” After all, the site was designed to market the game, not steer people away from it.

相反，你可以探索将许多评论合并为一个图表的聚合网站：

Instead, explore aggregator sites that collapse many reviews into a single figure:

·       Metacritic.com 和 GameRankings.com 为在线和印刷媒体上的评论提供平均评分。它并不全面，但涵盖了所有较大的群体。然而，该列表的一个缺点是，它对 Joe's Crappy Game Blog 的评分与对较大、更成熟的游戏评论网站的评分相同。

·      Metacritic.com and GameRankings.com provides an average rating for reviews appearing in online and print media. It is not comprehensive, but covers all the larger bases. A fault of the list, however, is that it rates Joe’s Crappy Game Blog the same as it rates the larger, more established game review sites.

·       Mobygames.com 在其网站上为每款游戏提供自己的 mobyscore，并拥有一个包含从屏幕截图到信用信息的所有内容的惊人数据库。GameFAQs.com 为许多游戏提供 FAQ（常见问题）。查看几个热门 FAQ，您可能会在第一款游戏中遇到诸如错误、漏洞和游戏平衡问题之类的问题。通常，FAQ 撰写者会忍不住将自己的评论插入 FAQ 中。

·      Mobygames.com provides its own mobyscore for each game on its site and has an amazing database that contains everything from screenshots to credit information. GameFAQs.com provides FAQs (frequently asked questions) for many games. Looking at a couple of the top FAQs, you’re likely to encounter things like bugs, exploits, and game balance issues in the first game. Often, the FAQ writer can’t help but to interject his commentary into the FAQ.

·       GameSpot.com、IGN.com、1Up.com 和其他网站提供评论者和玩家的评分。

·      GameSpot.com, IGN.com, 1Up.com and other sites offer both the reviewer’s and players’ ratings.

不要只从表面去看待事物，而要阅读来自最高、最低和中间各个方面的优质评论。

Instead of just taking things at face value, read a good collection of reviews from the top, bottom, and middle of the spectrum.

另一个获取游戏信息的好地方是公司支持的社区论坛以及社区外维护的论坛。这些论坛通常因系列而异。

Another good place to gain information about the game is at community boards supported by the company as well as those maintained outside the community. These generally vary from series to series.

挑战

CHALLENGES

作为一名崭露头角的游戏开发者，除非你进入独立游戏或严肃游戏领域，否则你很有可能在开发原创游戏之前先开发游戏的续集。这绝不是坏事，事实上，这是开发者在游戏行业起步的最佳方式之一。让我们面对现实吧——无论你以何种方式进入游戏行业，这都是一个好的开始。

As a budding game developer, the odds are good that you’ll work on a sequel to a game before you work on an original game, unless you enter the indie game or serious games space. Far from a bad thing, it’s actually one of the best ways for a developer to start in the game industry. Let’s face it—any way you get your start in the game industry is a good way to start.

挑战 1——这次我们要做好这件事

CHALLENGE 1—LET’S DO IT RIGHT THIS TIME

选择一款 GameRankings 或 MobyGames 评分为 65-75% 的游戏（也就是说，不算糟糕，但肯定不算出色），并且没有续集。首先，通过阅读多篇专业评论来研究原版游戏，以就游戏的最佳和最差功能达成共识。然后集思广益，想出理想的续集应该是什么样的。最后，为续集写一份一页纸的提案，给出简短的核心描述和功能列表（假设 ESRB 评级和目标受众与原版游戏相同）。如果界面存在问题，我们鼓励您在提案中附上新界面的概念草图。

Choose a game with a GameRankings or MobyGames score of 65–75 percent—that is, not terrible but certainly not great—and that has no sequel. First, research the original game by reading multiple professional reviews to get a consensus on what the game’s best and worst features are. Then brainstorm what an ideal sequel would be like. Finally, write a one-page proposal for a sequel, giving a short core description and a feature list (assume the same ESRB rating and target audience as the original game). If problems exist with the interface, you’re encouraged to include a concept sketch of the new interface in your pitch.

所需组件

Components Required

·      互联网连接（用于研究）

·      Internet connection (for research)

·      原版游戏和游戏机器（可选）

·      The original game and a machine to play it on (optional)

可交付成果

Deliverable

·      原版游戏的优点和缺点列表

·      List of the strengths and weaknesses of the original game

·      新游戏提案，提供简短的核心描述和功能列表

·      Proposal for a new game giving a short core description and a feature list

·      完成后的讨论

·      Discussion after completion

建议流程

Suggested Process

1.    找出重要的例子。想想你玩过的续集，它们要么比原版游戏好很多，要么比原版游戏差很多。将系列游戏分成两组（更好的续集和更好的原版）。每组中的游戏有什么共同点？两组之间的共同差异是什么？

1.    Identify important examples. Think about sequels you’ve played that were either significantly better or significantly worse than the original game. Separate the franchises into two groups (better sequels and better originals). What do the pairs of games in each group have in common? What are the common differences between the two groups?

2.    确定设计规则。每组游戏的共同点是什么？两组游戏之间的共同差异是什么？讨论后，列出自己制作续集时的设计规则清单。

2.    Identify design rules. What do the pairs of games in each group have in common? What are the common differences between the two groups? After discussing, come up with your own list of design rules when making a sequel.

3.    研究你的原创游戏。

3.    Research your original game.

4.    集思广益。集体讨论可能的概念。就一个概念达成一致，并充实一些基本细节。

4.    Brainstorm. In a group, discuss potential concepts. Agree on a single concept and flesh out some basic details.

5.    创建可交付成果。

5.    Create deliverable.

挑战 2 — 创建垄断 2

CHALLENGE 2—CREATING MONOPOLY 2

设计一款经典大富翁游戏的完整棋盘游戏续集。这不应该只是主题更新（如大富翁：此时此刻）。相反，应该更新游戏机制。

Design a full board game sequel to the classic Monopoly. This should not just be a thematic update (like Monopoly: Here and Now). Instead, update the game mechanics.

所需组件

Components Required

·      各种尺寸和形状的代币、海报板、索引卡

·      Tokens of various sizes and shapes, posterboard, index cards

·      原版游戏的副本（可选）

·      A copy of the original game (optional)

可交付成果

Deliverable

·      一个完整、可玩的实体游戏原型

·      A complete, playable physical game prototype

·      书面规则

·      Written rules

建议流程

Suggested Process

1.    集思广益，想出哪些要保留、哪些要改进、哪些要删除。首先思考一下原版游戏。哪些游戏玩法最精彩，哪些让游戏变得有价值？哪些机制是这些美学的根本原因？确保保留这些机制。在《大富翁》游戏中，是否有你一直想做的事情，但由于规则不允许而无法做到？游戏中最无聊或最令人沮丧的部分是什么？你能想出一种方法来改进这些部分，让它们更有趣吗？你能想出一种方法来完全删除它们，而不会破坏其余的游戏体验吗？游戏中是否有玩家期望在续集中出现的方面？确保不要删除任何观众期望的内容。对于所需的长度，你认为游戏需要更多策略还是更多运气？你能做出任何改变来改变平衡吗？（有关机会和技能之间的权衡的更多信息，请参阅第 8 章“机会和技能：寻找平衡”。）

1.    Brainstorm ideas for what to keep, what to improve, and what to remove. Start by thinking about the original game. What are the greatest gameplay moments, the ones that make playing worthwhile? What mechanics are the root cause of those aesthetics? Make sure that you keep those mechanics. Are there any things you always wanted to do in Monopoly, but couldn’t do because the rules prevented you from doing so? What are the most boring or frustrating parts of the game? Can you think of a way to improve those parts to make them more fun? Can you think of a way to remove them entirely without ruining the rest of the play experience? Are there any aspects of the game that players will expect to be in a sequel? Make sure you don’t remove anything that is an audience expectation. For the desired length, do you think the game needs more strategy or more luck? Can you make any changes to shift the balance one way or the other? (See Chapter 8, “Chance and Skill: Finding the Balance,” for more information on the tradeoff between chance and skill.)

2.    制定一套初步规则。将头脑风暴的结果汇总成一套连贯的规则，让团队中的所有设计师都能理解。规则可能尚未完成或组织良好——事实上，它们可能不会完成——但你应该有一个草稿。同意一些更改并付诸实施。请记住，游戏是一种互动媒介，无论我们谈论多少规则以及游戏过程中可能 发生的事情，你都无法确定，直到它真正发生。

2.    Write a tentative set of rules. Bring together the results of your brainstorming into a coherent set of rules that all of the designers in your group understand. The rules may not be complete or well organized yet—in fact, they probably won’t be—but you should have a rough draft. Agree on a few changes and run with them. Remember that games are an interactive medium, and no matter how much we talk about the rules and what might happen during play, you can’t be sure until it actually does happen.

3.    构建原型。 为续集创建组件。此时不要在原型上投入太多时间或精力；你肯定会发现需要更改的规则，如果你一开始就创建了“完美的棋盘”，那么强迫自己做出必要的更改就困难得多。原型应该是快速而粗糙的，但可玩，并随时准备更改。

3.    Build a prototype. Create the components for your sequel. Do not put very much time or effort into your prototype at this point; you will surely find rules that need to change, and it is much harder to force yourself to make needed changes if you created “the perfect board” right off the bat. Prototypes should be quick and dirty, but playable, and ready to change at a moment’s notice.

4.    在您​​的小组中进行游戏测试。玩您的原型。当您遇到规则说明、平衡问题或游戏中没有您想象的那么有趣的部分时，请记下来。不要害怕在玩游戏时更改规则。游戏测试不是为了获胜；而是要弄清楚游戏本身是否“有效”。继续修改和游戏测试，直到您的小组能够完成并享受游戏而不会遇到任何重大问题。完成游戏是一回事，享受游戏又是另一回事。确保您的游戏好玩。如果人们不想再玩它，这表明它不是一款好游戏。此外，在玩游戏时修改规则文档，确保所有规则都包含在文档中，并且以合乎逻辑、可读的方式组织。

4.    Playtest in your group. Play your prototype. Take notes as you run into rules clarifications, balance issues, or parts of the game that are not as fun as you thought they’d be. Don’t be afraid to change the rules as you play. This playtest isn’t about winning; it’s about figuring out if the game itself “works.” Continue revising and playtesting until your group can complete and enjoy a game without running into any major issues. Completing a game is one thing—enjoying it is another. Make sure that your game is fun to play. If people don’t want to play it again, that’s a sign that it’s not a good game. Also revise your rules document as you play, making sure that all of your rules are contained in the document and that it is organized in a logical, readable fashion.

5.    创建专业品质的原型（可选）。此时，值得创建一个具有专业外观的原型。复制一份具有最终品质的艺术品的游戏组件。制作美观的代币，并在卡片纸上打印任何卡片。（您可能需要访问专业打印机来执行此操作。）

5.    Create professional-quality prototype (optional). At this point, it is worth creating a professional-looking prototype. Make a copy of your game components with final-quality artwork. Create nice-looking tokens, and print any cards you may have on cardstock paper. (You may need to visit a professional printer to do this.)

变体

Variants

选择另一个经典棋盘游戏进行修改，例如RISK或Parcheesi。

Choose another classic board game to modify, such as RISK or Parcheesi.

挑战3——死而复生

CHALLENGE 3—RETURNING FROM THE DEAD

还记得世嘉 Genesis 的那款出色游戏 《暗影狂奔》吗？我们也不记得了，但我们听说 20 世纪 90 年代的所有游戏玩家都认为这款游戏非常有趣。我们称它为“黑马”。

Remember that great game Shadowrun for the Sega Genesis? Neither do we, but we hear it was really fun from everyone who was a gamer in the 1990s. Let’s call it a “sleeper hit.”

假设这款游戏可以在 WiiTM 虚拟控制台上下载，并且受到新一代游戏玩家的追捧，他们重新发现了这款经典游戏。假设在如此热销的宣传下，您的工作室（以及其他几家工作室）被委托在 Wii 上推出一款现代续集。

Suppose this game was made available for download on the WiiTM’s virtual console, and it took off with a new generation of gamers that rediscovered this old classic. And suppose that with all the hype, your studio (and several others) was contracted to propose a modern sequel on the Wii.

为续集创建一个概念宣传。

Create a concept pitch for the sequel.

所需组件

Components Required

·      互联网连接（用于研究）

·      Internet connection (for research)

可交付成果

Deliverable

·      一页纸的续集概念推介，或

·      One-page concept pitch for the sequel or

·      三个概念草图，每个草图都包含一个潜在界面和一个主要的、更新的游戏角色（每个概念草图都应该与其他草图不同，并展示出探索各种可能性的尝试）或

·      Three concept sketches each of a potential interface and a main, updated character for the game (each concept sketch should differ from the others and show an attempt to explore possibilities) or

·      完成后的讨论

·      Discussion after completion

建议流程

Suggested Process

1.    研究原版游戏。如果你不熟悉这款游戏，请阅读评论和常见问题解答，以熟悉游戏的类型、优点、缺点和整体机制。如果你恰好有幸拥有原版世嘉 Genesis 和Shadowrun，那就更好了。不过，这不是必要的。

1.    Research the original game. If you are unfamiliar with the game, read reviews and FAQs to familiarize yourself with the game’s genre, strengths, weaknesses, and overall mechanics. If you happen to be lucky enough to own an original Sega Genesis and Shadowrun, so much the better. It’s not necessary, though.

2.    集思广益。在小组中讨论潜在的概念。玩家喜欢什么？什么应该保持不变？什么应该改进？什么应该删除？动作/角色扮演类游戏（自原版游戏发布以来）中的哪些新创新可以加以调整，以增强原版游戏的可玩性？

2.    Brainstorm. In a group, discuss potential concepts. What did players like? What should remain the same? What should be improved? What should be removed? What new innovations in the action/RPG genre (ever since the original game was released) could be adapted to enhance the gameplay of the original?

3.    创建可交付成果。

3.    Create deliverable.

变体

Variants

用不同的游戏来完成这个挑战。选择一款已有 10 多年历史的游戏，该游戏广受好评（评分高，或者至少在游戏发布时玩家普遍怀有怀旧之情），但从未推出过真正的续集，或者在 10 多年前才推出其上一部续集。

Do this challenge with a different game. Choose a game that is more than 10 years old, that was well received (high review scores, or at least a general sense of nostalgia among gamers that were around when it was released), but that never launched a true sequel or launched its last sequel more than 10 years ago.

选择一款你玩过的最近发布的游戏，并创建它的精神续集。一定要加入你自己的设计风格和功能，让原版游戏的粉丝们会喜欢，但不要直接抄袭原版游戏的设计。

Select a recently released game that you’ve played, and create its spiritual sequel. Be sure to include your own design touch and features that the original game’s fans would enjoy without stealing the original game’s design outright.

挑战 X+1：续集

CHALLENGE X+1: THE SEQUEL

本书中有许多游戏设计挑战。如果您以团队形式应对这些挑战，那么您可能会创造出一些您不愿承认的游戏创意。大多数设计师都会在某个时候遇到这种情况。不过，为了应对这个挑战，我们要求您不仅要记住那些不太出色的努力，而且这次要做好。为您或您的队友在之前的挑战中提出或创建的游戏的续集创建一个宣传片。

Throughout this book, there are many game-design challenges. If you’re working through these challenges as a group, you’ve likely created some game ideas that you’d rather not admit you created. It happens to most designers at some point or another. For the sake of this challenge, though, we’re going to ask that you not only remember that less-than-stellar effort, but do it right this time. Create a pitch for a sequel to a game that you or your teammates proposed or created in a previous challenge.

所需组件

Components Required

·      没有任何

·      None

可交付成果

Deliverable

·      完成后的非正式演示或

·      Informal presentation after completion or

·      为之前创建的任何可交付成果准备一份“续集”

·      Prepare a “sequel” to whatever deliverable was previously created

 

 

变体

Variants

选择一个人们不会自然联想到娱乐软件项目的 IP，例如集邮、美国邮政服务或加拿大移民局。花 10 分钟尝试为您选择的 IP 创建核心和功能集。接下来，选择另一位设计师或另一个团队，并让他们创建您创建的项目的续集。

Select an IP that one would not naturally associate with an entertainment software project, such as stamp collecting, the United States Postal Service, or Canadian immigration. Spend 10 minutes trying to create a core and feature set for the IP you’ve selected. Next, select another designer or another team, and task them with creating the sequel to the project that you have created.

铁人设计师挑战 5 — 臭名昭著的糟糕（现场）

IRON DESIGNER CHALLENGE 5—INFAMOUSLY BAD (LIVE)

当你熟悉制作续集后，可以尝试这个练习。分成 2 到 4 人的小团队。

After you’re comfortable making sequels, try this exercise. Split into teams of two to four individuals.

让每个团队选择一款受到批评（GameRankings 或 MetaCritic 上的得分为 40％ 或更低）且没有续集的游戏。

Have each team choose a game that was critically panned (score of 40 percent or less on GameRankings or MetaCritic) which has not had a sequel.

或者使用这个列表：

Or use this list:

·      大卡车(PC)

·      Big Rigs (PC)

·       《侵入者：侏罗纪公园》（PC）

·      Trespasser: Jurassic Park (PC)

·      搏击俱乐部(PS2)（M 级）

·      Fight Club (PS2) (M-rated)

·       BMX XXX (GameCube)（M 级）

·      BMX XXX (GameCube) (M-rated)

·       25 to Life (PS2)（M 级）

·      25 to Life (PS2) (M-rated)

·      超人（N64）

·      Superman (N64)

这些游戏在业界（以及玩家社区）都声名狼藉。每个幸运团队都会被分配到其中一款游戏（以团队选择的任何方式：例如，通过掷骰子随机分配；领导者的选择；或者每个团队可以选择另一个团队来玩他们的游戏）。你的任务是为续集创建一个严肃的概念宣传，这个宣传非常鼓舞人心，你可能会说服出版商让你尝试一下。

Each of these games is infamous within the industry (and within the gamer community). Each lucky team gets assigned one of these games (by any means that your group chooses: for example, randomly assigned by die roll; leader’s choice; or each team gets to choose another team to inflict their game on). Your mission is to create a serious concept pitch for a sequel, a pitch so inspiring that you might actually convince a publisher to let you have a go at it.

所需组件

Components Required

·      用于研究的互联网连接

·      Internet connection for research

可交付成果

Deliverable

·      完成后的非正式演示或

·      Informal presentation after completion or

·      正式的产品推介

·      Formal product pitch

·       3-5页的概念文件

·      3–5-page concept document

建议流程

Suggested Process

1.    接受和研究。选择游戏后，上网研究一下。阅读一些负面评论。在 YouTube 上查找游戏视频。享受负面评论带来的乐趣。

1.    Acceptance and research. After you’ve selected your game, go online and research it. Read some of the bad reviews. Look for game footage on YouTube. Have fun enjoying the bad.

2.    集思广益，确定游戏核心。 无论游戏好坏，还是介于两者之间，游戏规则都是一样的。无论游戏有多糟糕，它肯定在某个地方有一些小小的乐趣（即使是无意的）。即使没有，你至少可以看看它，自己决定最初的设计师认为乐趣应该在哪里。不仅要决定原版游戏的糟糕之处，还要决定它的潜力在哪里：为什么游戏如此令人失望，它本来可以变成什么样？这是你为续集思考的方向

2.    Brainstorm a core. Whether the game is good, bad, or anywhere in between, the rules are still the same. No matter how bad a game is, it is sure to have some tiny nugget of fun in it somewhere (even if accidentally). Even if not, you can at least look at it and decide for yourself where the original designers thought the fun was supposed to be. Decide not only what was so bad about the original game, but also where the potential was: Why was the game so disappointing, and what could it have been? This is the direction you should be thinking about for your sequel

3.    创建功能集。列出四到五个支持游戏核心的功能。请记住，人们对续集有一定的期望，因此完全抛弃前作的所有特色是行不通的。毕竟，如果你不打算使用前作的任何内容，你为什么要使用 IP？

3.    Create a feature set. Create a list of four to five features that support the core of the game. Remember that people have certain expectations of a sequel, so completely jettisoning everything that made the previous game distinctive won’t work. After all, if you didn’t plan to use anything from the previous game, why would you be using the IP?

4.    创建可交付成果。

4.    Create deliverable.

非数字短片

NON-DIGITAL SHORTS

续集和扩展包在非数字市场中很受欢迎。只要问问玩过《万智牌：聚会》的任何人就知道了。这些短片让你有机会利用现有游戏来寻找扩展解决方案。

Sequels and expansion packs are big in the non-digital market. Just ask anyone who’s ever played Magic: The Gathering. These shorts give you an opportunity to work with existing games to find expansion solutions.

1.    扩展：为Risk设计一个扩展包。包括一个比原版图更小的版图，其中至少包含五个新国家。

1.    Expand: Design an expansion pack for Risk. Include a smaller board with at least five new nations than extends the original board.

2.    探索：选择一款成功的领土游戏（如《卡坦岛》）并重新设计它，以包含另一款领土游戏的热门功能。

2.    Explore: Choose a successful territory game (such as Settlers of Catan) and redesign it to include a popular feature from another territory game.

3.    消除：选择一款平庸的棋盘游戏（例如Sorry!），并找出至少两个薄弱的机制。通过消除或替换这些机制来重新设计游戏。

3.    Exterminate: Choose a mediocre board game (such as Sorry!) and identify at least two weak mechanics. Redesign the game by eliminating or replacing these mechanics.

4.设计一款    以二战战斗而非中世纪战斗为基础的国际象棋续集。

4.    Design a sequel for Chess based on WWII combat instead of medieval.

5.    选择一款冗长、主题鲜明的棋盘游戏（如《轴心国与同盟国》或《山丘之屋的背叛》），并将其重新设计，就好像它是由三个独立的游戏组成的三部曲。

5.    Choose a lengthy, thematic board game (such as Axis & Allies or Betrayal at House on the Hill) and redesign it as if it had been created as a trilogy of three separate games.

6.    创建一个经典纸牌游戏（如Hearts）的克隆版，并融入“新”技术——可交易/可收集的纸牌、多面骰子或基于砖块的棋盘。

6.    Create a clone of a classic card game (such as Hearts) that incorporates “new” technology —tradable/collectible cards, multi-sided dice, or a tile-based board.

7.为    大富翁游戏制作一个模组 ，主题为“贫民窟领主和黑帮老大”。注意：制作模组时，您 必须使用原始棋盘和所有原始代币。

7.    Create a mod for Monopoly with the theme “slum lords and mob bosses.” Note: as a mod, you must use the original board and all original tokens.

8.    选择每年或每两年出现一次的主题（例如政治选举或假期），并设计一款计划每年发布的基于图块的游戏。  

8.    Choose a theme that happens annually or bi-annually (such as political elections or holiday seasons) and design a tile-based game intended for yearly release.  

9.根据故事的发展，设计    《生命游戏》的续集——在原版游戏结束时玩家退休后会发生什么。

9.    Design a sequel to The Game of Life based on progression of story—what happens after the players reach retirement at the end of the original game.

10. 设计一个包含 100 张卡片（两包索引卡）的集换式卡牌游戏的初稿。使用其他人尚未探索或意想不到的独特 IP 或主题。

10. Design a first draft of a collectible card game incorporating 100 cards (two packs of index cards). Use a unique IP or theme that others haven’t explored or aren’t expecting.



 

 

11：瞄准市场

11: Targeting a Market

如果你进入游戏行业并呆得足够久，你就会为其他目标人群做宣传。假设你是一个受过良好教育、来自中西部小城市的贫困学生贷款人；你可能会被要求为纽约共和党党团设计一款游戏、一款第一人称射击游戏的扩展包、一款 MMOG 的 10 个新任务，或者一款针对经常使用特定社交网络的年轻女孩的在线休闲游戏。

If you get into the game industry and stay long enough, you will work on a pitch that targets a demographic other than your own. Suppose that you’re a well educated, student-loan poor person from a small Midwestern city; you may be asked to design a game for the New York Republican Caucus, an expansion pack to a first-person shooter, 10 new missions for an MMOG, or an online casual game for young girls that frequent a specific social network.

“但我永远不会为制作这种游戏的公司工作。”

“But I’d never work for a company that made games like that.”

是的，你会的。你加入的公司及其现有产品并不能保证未来的项目。公司会实现多元化并创造新的收入来源。它们被出售、收购、被要求从事较小的特殊项目，或为某件事创建功能原型。有时，公司内的设计团队会通过进行本书中的设计练习来锻炼他们的智力。在任何约束条件下快速设计的能力是优秀设计师的标志。学会真正在媒介中跳舞，无论它给你带来什么，你都会变得更好。

Yes, you would. The company you join and its current products are not a guarantee of future projects. Companies diversify and create new revenue streams. They are sold off, purchased, asked to work on smaller, special projects, or create functional prototypes for one thing or another. Sometimes, design teams within companies stretch their mental muscle by performing design exercises just like the ones in this book. The ability to rapidly design within any set of constraints is the hallmark of a good designer. Learn to really dance in the medium, no matter what it throws at you, and you’ll be much better off.

游戏行业经常使用某些人口统计数据（年龄、性别），而其他一些统计数据几乎不被使用（种族、宗教、收入水平、职业、政治倾向）。请注意，虽然娱乐游戏中的后一种类别大多被忽略或令人遗憾地被定型，但对于严肃游戏来说，它们绝对可以发挥作用。

Some demographics are used quite frequently in the game industry (age, gender) and others practically not at all (race, religion, income level, occupation, political affiliation). Note that the latter categories, while mostly ignored or sadly stereotyped in entertainment games, can quite definitely come into play for serious games.

我为什么要关心这些？这不是营销人员该做的事情吗？

WHY DO I CARE? ISN’T THIS FOR MARKETING PEOPLE?

与知识产权和续集不同，瞄准某个市场并不是为了降低风险（毕竟，它将市场限制在特定的人群范围内），而是为了打入出版商感觉到机会或有目的的服务不足的市场。

Unlike IP and sequels, targeting a market is not done to mitigate risk (it specifically limits the market to the chosen demographics, after all), but to break into an underserved market where the publisher senses an opportunity or has a purpose.

例如，命运多舛的紫月（Purple Moon）和最近的育碧想象（Ubisoft Imagine）都在制作“女孩游戏”——这并不是因为这样做没有风险，而是因为有很多女孩对玩电子游戏感兴趣，而一款能卖给所有（或大多数）女孩的游戏将会带来巨大的利润。

For example, both the ill-fated Purple Moon and the more recent Ubisoft Imagine are making “games for girls”—not because this isn’t risky, but because there are a lot of girls out there who are interested in playing video games, and a game that sells to all (or most) of them would be immensely profitable.

一方面，针对特定市场的游戏会增加“市场渗透率”（即该市场中购买游戏的人数百分比），同时降低“大众市场吸引力”。这是一种权衡，决定它是否值得确实是我们付钱给营销人员做的事情。

On the one hand, a game targeted at a specific market increases “market penetration” (the percentage of people within that market who will buy the game) while decreasing “mass-market appeal.” This is a tradeoff, and deciding whether it is worthwhile is indeed what we pay marketers to do.

一旦出版商的营销人员完成了研究并确定某个目标市场值得追求，他们可能会向几家开发商发出 RFP（征求建议书）（就像他们对 IP 所做的那样），然后由你，设计师，来创建针对特定市场的产品提案。

Once a publisher’s marketing people have done their research and determined that a certain target market is worth pursuing, they might issue an RFP (request for proposals) to several developers (just like they do with an IP), and it is up to you, the designer, to create a product proposal targeted at the given market.

在严肃游戏领域，软件的设计目标通常不是销售无数台，而是实现特定目的。事实上，软件可能会免费赠送！例如，某个项目的目标可能是教学生如何为大学教育存钱。其他时候，游戏的唯一目的可能是编辑。事实上，2007 年，《纽约时报》将游戏纳入其编辑报道的一部分。

In the serious games space, software is often designed not with the goal of selling a zillion units, but instead with achieving a specific purpose. In fact, the software may be given away! For instance, the goal of a particular project may be teaching students how to save money for a college education. Other times, a game’s sole purpose may be editorial. In 2007, in fact, the New York Times incorporated games as part of its editorial coverage.

了解你的目标市场

LEARNING ABOUT YOUR TARGET MARKET

与基于知识产权的游戏不同，你通常不需要从对目标市场有全面的了解开始。事实上，除非你自己就是目标市场的一部分，否则你可能对什么样的东西会吸引市场知之甚少。如果你的任务是为老年人制作一款健身游戏，你知道从哪里开始吗？

Unlike a game based on IP, you do not usually start with a body of knowledge about your target market. In fact, unless you are part of the target market yourself, you probably know very little about what kinds of things will appeal to the market. If you were tasked with creating an exercise game for senior citizens, would you know where to start?

有时，你可以找到科学研究（通常是在心理学或广告领域）来描述吸引特定人群的个别事物。但人口统计学文献搜索比玩系列中的前一款游戏（如续集）或观看一堆电视节目（如知识产权）要困难得多。它耗费更多时间，而且研究结果可能并不直接适用于你的游戏。

Occasionally, you can find scientific research (most often in the fields of psychology or advertising) that describes individual things that appeal to certain demographics. But a demographic literature search is much more difficult than playing the previous game in a series, as in the case of a sequel, or watching a bunch of television shows, as in the case of IP. It is far more time consuming, and the results of the research may not apply directly to your game.

在某些情况下，发行商可能已经做过研究，并将把研究结果转交给你。有时，他们也没有这些信息，或者他们直到接受了你的提案后才会提供给你。其他时候，你会与外部主题专家合作。经验丰富的游戏设计师会培养这样的联系。

In some cases, the publisher may have already done this research and will pass it on to you. Sometimes, they do not have this information either, or else they will not make it available to you until after they’ve accepted your proposal. Other times, you will work with outside subject matter experts. Experienced game designers cultivate connections like these.

但是，无论你得到多少信息，都要自己做一些研究，联系目标市场的人，问他们希望在这款游戏中看到什么。不要以为你可以通过查看针对同一市场的其他内容来自己弄清楚。许多目标游戏（和其他娱乐）都惨遭失败，通常是因为他们有一个由中年男性组成的开发团队，试图为八岁女孩制作游戏，但他们做错了。即使是成功的产品，它们成功的原因也并不总是很清楚，如果你抄袭了错误的部分，而忽略了让这些产品发挥作用的那个微妙的东西，你的项目就失败了。

No matter how much information you’re given, though, do some research yourself by contacting people in your target market and asking them what they’d like to see in this game. Don’t assume you can figure it out on your own by looking at other content targeted at the same market. Many targeted games (and other entertainment) fail miserably, often because they have (say) a development team full of middle-aged males trying to make a game for eight-year-old girls, and they get it wrong. Even for the products that are successful, it is not always clear why they are successful, and if you copy the wrong parts while missing that one subtle thing that makes those products work, your project is dead.

目标市场的能力

ABILITIES OF THE TARGET MARKET

“人各有所好。” 每句俗语背后都有道理，这句话也不例外。在为不同的目标市场设计游戏时，设计师必须考虑全局。

“Different strokes for different folks.”  There’s truth behind every common saying, and this one is no exception. When designing games for different target markets, it’s important for a designer to take into account the whole picture.

阅读能力

READING ABILITIES

设计师在为儿童设计独立软件时最常犯的一个错误就是高估了儿童的阅读能力。一般来说，儿童在四五岁时就开始阅读，但即便如此，他们阅读的也很可能只是一些常见的视觉词，例如“黄色”、“the”、“away”和“a”，而不是引人入胜的游戏叙事内容。即使是没有叙事的游戏，也会因为“保存游戏”、“加载游戏”或“开始新游戏”等选项而让孩子停下脚步。有些游戏会用画外音来复述游戏文本，以帮助儿童跟上游戏节奏。

One of the most common mistakes made by designers creating indie software designs for children is overestimating their ability to read. In general, children start reading at age four or five, but even then, it’s more likely common sight words such as “yellow,” “the,” “away,” and “a,” not exactly the stuff of riveting game narratives. Even games without narratives can stop a young kid in his or her tracks with options like “Save Game,” “Load Game,” or “Start New Game.” Some games echo game text with voiceovers to help children follow along.

当然，年幼的孩子并不是唯一有阅读困难的人。本书的一位作者曾参与过一个严肃的游戏项目，该项目针对的是贫民窟的青少年和年轻人。根据该项目的规定，游戏中禁止使用文字，但完全可以进行口头对话。

Young children aren’t the only ones who have difficulty reading, of course. One of the authors of this book worked on a serious game project which targeted inner-city teens and young adults. As a mandate of the project, in-game text was off limits, though spoken dialogue was perfectly permissible.

学习曲线

LEARNING CURVE

对于一个精通游戏的六岁孩子来说，视频游戏控制器可能和叉子一样常见（甚至更常见）。然而，对于年龄较大的人，游戏控制器可能是“给孩子用的”，他们根本不懂。无论游戏看起来多么有趣，如果控制器的感知学习曲线太高，人们就会认为不值得付出努力。即使你的控制器真的很容易学习，也没关系。除非他们尝试，否则他们不会知道这一点，而且由于人们经常在尝试之前就否定某样东西——这就是感知学习曲线——你没有机会改变他们的想法。

For a game-savvy six year old, a video-game controller might be as common as (or more common than) a fork. For older individuals, however, a game controller might be “for kids” and something they just don’t understand. No matter how fun a game looks, if the controller’s perceived learning curve is too high, people will dismiss it as not worth the effort. It doesn’t matter if your controls are actually easy to learn. They won’t know that unless they try, and since people often dismiss things before they try—that’s the perceived learning curve—you won’t have that chance to change their minds.

任天堂 DS 的控制器类似于笔，而任天堂 Wii 的控制器类似于遥控器，它们都利用感知知识来发挥自己的优势。许多针对较大市场的游戏甚至提供练习模式，让玩家可以熟悉游戏，而不会感到必须完美表现的压力。

Both the Nintendo DS, whose controller resembles a pen, and the Nintendo Wii, whose controller resembles a remote control, used perceived knowledge to their advantage. Many games that target a larger market even offer a practice mode where players can get familiar with the game without feeling pressure to perform perfectly.

学习曲线不仅限于控制器。游戏中为经验丰富的玩家提供有用反馈的常见惯例，如生命值计、生命值、子屏幕和平视显示器，对于从未玩过电子游戏的人来说可能很陌生和令人困惑。如果您在针对特定人群的游戏中包含这些元素，您可能需要非常小心地解释它们是什么以及如何使用它们，而不会让玩家一开始就不知所措。

The learning curve goes beyond the controller. Common conventions in games that provide useful feedback for experienced players, like life meters, hit points, subscreens and heads-up displays may be unfamiliar and confusing to someone who has never played a video game before. If you include these elements in a game that targets certain demographics, you may have to take great care to explain what they are and how to use them, without initially overwhelming the player.

认知能力

COGNITIVE ABILITIES

许多六岁儿童不玩《Risk》是有原因的。这与大多数严肃的棋盘游戏玩家觉得《Monopoly》无聊得像干白面包一样的原因相同——这两款游戏都无法挑战玩家的认知能力。对于一般的六岁儿童来说，在《Risk》中取得成功所需的战略水平超出了他们的能力，因此他们放弃了，失去了兴趣或感到沮丧。《Monopoly》之类的游戏也无法挑战年龄较大的玩家的认知能力。正如不止一位玩家所说，如果游戏的结果主要取决于运气，那么锻炼任何智力有什么意义呢？

There’s a reason many six year olds don’t play Risk. It’s the same reason that most serious board game players find Monopoly boring as dry white toast—both games fail to challenge the player cognitively. For average six year olds, the level of strategizing necessary to succeed in Risk is more than they can muster, so they give up, disinterested or frustrated. Games like Monopoly also fail to challenge older players cognitively. As more than one player has said, if the outcome of the game is largely based on luck, what’s the point of exercising any mental muscle?

游戏中存在的认知挑战取决于目标市场……或将定义它。

The cognitive challenge present in the game is dependent upon the target market... or will define it.

学习风格

LEARNING STYLE

设计师 Sheri Graner Ray在她的著作《性别包容性游戏设计》中指出，男性和女性的学习方式不同。男性采用探索性学习，而女性采用模仿行为。男性拿起控制器就开始玩。女性则希望先看一看，或者至少阅读一下手册。Graner Ray 建议设计师在创建游戏教程时考虑到这些不同的学习方式。

In her book Gender Inclusive Game Design, designer Sheri Graner Ray points out that men and women have different learning styles. Men use explorative learning while women use modeling behavior. Men grab the controller and go. Women want to watch first, or at the very least read the manual. Graner Ray advises designers to take these different learning styles into account when creating game tutorials.

身体能力

PHYSICAL ABILITIES

当微软发布第一代 Xbox 时，北美版本附带的控制器对于许多儿童的手来说太大了。许多没有“大手”的人也发现控制器难以使用。微软后来用“S 型”控制器取代了该控制器，这是日本的标准配置。这给了我们一个重要的教训：在创建产品时，要考虑目标受众的运动技能。

When Microsoft released the original Xbox, the controller that shipped with the North American units was too large for many children’s hands. Lots of people without “man hands” also found the controller challenging to use. Microsoft later replaced that controller with the “S-type” controller, which was standard in Japan. The lesson is an important one: In creating your product, consider the motor skills of your target audience.

年幼的孩子尚未建立良好的运动控制能力，因此，一款要求精准度的游戏（如果这不是主要目标）可能会带来更多的挫败感而不是乐趣。VTech V.Smile 游戏机专为儿童设计，配有大号彩色按钮，不容错过。同样，老年人，尤其是患有关节炎的人，可能难以完成许多游戏所需的重复按压和点击。对于许多人来说，任天堂 DS 的触控笔更容易使用。

Young children have yet to establish good motor control, and as such, a game that requires precision, provided that’s not the main goal, might cause more frustration than fun. The VTech V.Smile console was specifically created for children and features big color-coded buttons that can’t possibly be missed. Similarly, older individuals, particularly those with arthritis, may have difficulty with the repetitive pressing and clicking required by many games. The stylus for the Nintendo DS is much easier for many to use.

当然，身体能力并不局限于使用控制器。在 PC 上，需要大量鼠标点击的游戏可能会让患有关节炎或腕管综合症的人完全无法玩游戏。对于非常年幼或年老的人，甚至一个恰好桌子凌乱或鼠标球很脏的正常健康成年人来说，使用鼠标进行极其精确的操作（例如，移动到距离目标一两个像素的范围内）是不可能的。

Physical abilities aren’t limited to use of a controller, of course. On the PC, a game that requires a lot of mouse-clicks may prevent someone with arthritis or carpal tunnel syndrome from playing entirely. Requiring extreme precision with the mouse (for example, moving to within a pixel or two of the target) will be impossible for the very young or the very old, or even a normal, healthy adult who just happens to have a cluttered desk or a dirty mouse ball.

触觉欲望

TACTILE DESIRES

从打开盒子的那一刻起，玩家就开始触摸游戏的各个部分。物品几乎立刻被贴上“优质”或“廉价”的标签，细微的触感也引人注目。有些游戏会用布袋装游戏部件；而有些游戏会用塑料袋装，甚至根本没有袋子。从砖块的厚度到代币所用木材的质量和重量，所有这些都会影响玩家对游戏的整体看法。特别是在儿童游戏中，触觉元素极其重要。孩子们正是通过这些部件来体验游戏。他们触摸它们，把它们放进嘴里，有时甚至在游戏之外将它们用作玩具。

From the minute the box is opened, players begin to touch the various parts of the game. Things are labeled “quality” or “cheap” almost instantly, and small touches are noticed. In some games, there is a cloth bag to hold the game bits; in others, there is a plastic bag or no bag at all. From the thickness of the tiles to the quality and weight of the wood used in the tokens, all of it factors into a player’s overall opinion of the game. In children’s games in particular, the tactile components are extremely important. It is through these pieces that children experience the game. They touch them, put them in their mouths, and sometimes even use them as toys outside of the game.

这些触觉考虑并不局限于非数字游戏。打开 Xbox 360 包装后，许多玩家对连接设备与电视的线缆发表了评论。尽管这些线缆从未直接投入使用，但玩家对其质量印象深刻，因此也对系统印象深刻。同样，形状像遥控器的 Wii 也为玩家所熟悉，因此未能像传统控制器那样引起警觉（或引起相同数量的警觉）。

These tactile considerations are not limited to non-digital games. Unpacking the Xbox 360, many players commented upon the cables that connected the unit to the televisions. Though these cables never entered directly into play, players were impressed by their quality and therefore, impressed by the system as well. Likewise, the Wii, shaped like a remote control, was also familiar to players and therefore failed to set off alarm bells (or the same amount of alarm bells) that a traditional controller otherwise would have.

焦点小组

FOCUS GROUPS

焦点小组对游戏设计师来说非常有价值，尤其是那些瞄准自己经验之外的市场的游戏设计师。通过召集​​一群代表产品目标市场的人，焦点小组让设计师有机会在游戏向大众市场发布之前征集问题、测试理论，并观察他们的游戏是如何被玩或被当作一个概念来考虑的。这种体验通常会揭示意料之外的问题、提出改进建议并验证您已经做出的设计决策。

Focus groups are invaluable to game designers, particularly those targeting a market outside their own experience. By bringing together a group of individuals that represents the product’s desired target market, focus groups give designers an opportunity to solicit questions, test theories, and watch their game being played or considered as a concept before the game is released to the general market. The experience often illuminates unanticipated problems, suggests improvements, and validates design decisions you’ve already made.

鼓励测试人员积极回应并不要捍卫你的想法，从而提供反馈。没有什么比捍卫自己想法的开发人员更能阻止一次良好的反馈会议了，即使这些想法是好的。请记住，你听到的内容有助于你改进。这并不是要求你改变现状。

Encourage your testers to give feedback by responding positively and not defending your ideas. Nothing can shut down a good feedback session like a developer who defends her ideas, even if they are good ones. Remember, what you hear helps you to refine. It’s not a mandate to change things.

对于本章中的至少一个挑战，我们建议您考虑将焦点小组作为练习的一部分。

For at least one of the challenges in this chapter, we suggest you consider incorporating a focus group as part of the exercise.

大众市场

THE MASS MARKET

针对特定市场（例如有限的人口群体）与“大众市场”相反，大众市场指的是游戏的目标是尽可能广泛地面向所有 人口群体销售。直观来看，大众市场游戏似乎根本没有针对性。事实上，情况恰恰相反——这些游戏的设计者对广泛的人口群体有了解，以避免排除任何人。

Targeting a specific market, such as a limited demographic, is in opposition to the “mass market,” meaning a game with the goal of selling to as wide a range as possible across all demographics. Intuitively, it would seem that mass market games are not targeted at all. In fact, the reverse is true—designers of these games have an understanding of a broad range of demographics in order to avoid excluding anyone.

欧式游戏是研究大众市场吸引力的一个有趣案例。欧式游戏也被称为“德国游戏”或“设计师游戏”，其名称源于许多游戏的设计和玩法所在地。一般来说，它们是适合所有年龄段（男性和女性）的家庭游戏。《卡坦岛》是第一款在北美流行该类型的游戏；其他知名游戏包括《卡卡颂》和《波多黎各》。就本书而言，欧式游戏是一种非数字游戏，其特征如下：

Eurogames are an interesting case study in mass-market appeal. Also known as “German games” or “designer games,” Eurogames were given their name because of the area where many of them were designed and played. In general, they are family games that can be enjoyed by all ages, male and female. Settlers of Catan was the first game to popularize the genre in North America; other well-known games include Carcassonne and Puerto Rico. For the purposes of this book, a Eurogame is a non-digital game defined by the following characteristics:

·      游戏时间大约为 20 到 90 分钟。如果游戏时间太短，成年人会觉得结束得太快。如果游戏时间太长，孩子们会感到无聊。

·      Playable in roughly 20 to 90 minutes. If a game is too short, adults feel it’s over too quickly. If it takes too long, children get bored.

·      设置时间短。游戏设置是玩游戏所必需的繁琐工作。它不是游戏乐趣的一部分，因为无需做出任何决定。

·      Short setup time. Game setup is busywork required in order to play the game. It’s not part of the fun of the game because no decisions are being made.

·      规则简单，学习曲线短。儿童和许多成年人不喜欢坐着一动不动地听 20 分钟解释所有规则。

·      Simple rules, short learning curve. Children—and many adults—don’t enjoy sitting still and listening attentively for 20 minutes while all of the rules are explained.

·      合作，而非对抗。欧洲游戏经常使用涉及玩家合作的机制，例如交易和谈判，而不是一个玩家主动伤害另一个玩家的纯粹破坏性机制。对抗性机制可能会导致年幼的孩子之间发生激烈的争斗，并且往往会引导成年人做出非最佳目标决策，以避免同样的问题。合作游戏的美妙之处在于它能够让每个人感到舒适，无论他们的技能水平如何。新玩家和专家玩家可以相互合作，每个人都可以弥补对方的缺点。请注意，这并不意味着游戏不能具有竞争力；合作游戏仍然可以涉及激烈的竞争。

·      Cooperative, not confrontational. Eurogames frequently use mechanics that involve player cooperation, such as trading and negotiation, over purely destructive mechanics where one player actively harms another. Confrontational mechanics can cause bitter fights among younger children, and also tend to steer adult targeting decisions in non-optimal directions in order to avoid that same issue. The beauty of co-op play lies in its ability to make everyone feel comfortable regardless of their skill level. New players and expert players can work with one another, each able to take up the others shortcomings. Note that this does not mean the game can’t be competitive; cooperative games can still involve intense competition.

·      包含战略决策和可衡量的随机性，如第 5 章所述。过多的运气或非结构化的随机性无法让成年人做出有意义的决策，从而让他们保持参与。过多的策略和孩子永远不会赢，除非大人允许他们赢。

·      Contains strategic decision making along with measured randomness, as described in Chapter 5. Too much luck or unstructured randomness fails to give adults the meaningful decisions that keep them engaged. Too much strategy and children can never win unless the adults let them.

·      尽量减少玩家的停机时间。欧洲游戏在有回合时，通常允许玩家在其他玩家的回合中采取行动，或者将回合缩短到没有人只是坐着等待自己的回合。所有年龄段的玩家都不喜欢大部分时间都花在等待上的游戏。

·      Minimal player downtime. Eurogames, when they have turns at all, often allow players to take actions on other players’ turns, or else keep the turns short enough that no one is just sitting around waiting for their turn. Players of all ages tend to dislike a game where most of their time is spent waiting.

挑战

CHALLENGES

所有游戏都有目标市场。通常，该目标市场是与授权一起出现的。然而，在你的职业生涯中，你可能会被要求创建一款针对特定市场的游戏。你可能熟悉它，也可能不熟悉。如果你在一家大型发行商或严肃游戏公司工作，那么学习如何将你的游戏定位到特定市场是一项关键技能。

All games have target markets. Usually, that target comes with the license. At some point in your career, however, you may be asked to create a game targeted toward a specific market. You may be familiar with it, or you may not. If you work for a bigger publisher or in serious games, then learning how to target your games to a specific market is a key skill.

挑战 1 — 女孩装备

CHALLENGE 1—GEARS FOR GIRLS

第一人称射击游戏已经吸引了大量女性玩家（例如 Frag Dolls 和 PMS Clan）。但假设某家发行商想将 FPS 类型游戏专门瞄准8 至 16 岁的女性，并且假设（违背您的意愿）您被要求制定提案。请记住，FPS 游戏也不一定需要大型、凶猛的枪支。拓展游戏的视野，特别是因为您的部分市场只有 8 岁。

First-person shooters already appeal to a great number of females (witness the Frag Dolls and PMS Clan). But suppose a publisher had the idea of taking the FPS genre and targeted it exclusively at females ages eight to 16, and suppose that (against your will) you have been tasked with creating a proposal. Remember that FPSs don’t have to involve big, nasty guns, either. Expand the game’s horizons, particularly since part of your market is only eight years old.

所需组件

Components Required

·      没有任何

·      None

可交付成果

Deliverable

·      对目标市场进行令人信服的讨论，包括理想的游戏风格、功能、机制等的列表，以及原因。

·      A convincing discussion on the target market, including a list of game styles, features, mechanics, and so on that would be desirable—and why.

·      产品功能列表

·      Feature list of the product

·      游戏 HUD（平视显示器）的概念草图或模型

·      Concept sketches or mock-up of the game’s HUD (heads-up display)

建议流程

Suggested Process

1.    召集一个焦点小组。在这个人群中找一些人。（在课堂上，讲师可能会带一些人来听课，进行小组问答，或者让个人或小组自己寻找焦点小组。对于没有上课的人来说，你只能自己寻找。）请记住向小组提问和进行个人采访之间的区别。考虑将两者结合起来，以避免“群体思维”。

1.    Bring together a focus group. Find some people in this demographic. (In a class, the instructor may bring some people to the lecture for a group Q&A session, or it may be left to individuals or groups to find a focus group on their own. For people not taking a class, you’re on your own for this.) Keep in mind the difference between asking questions of a group and doing individual interviews. Consider doing a mix of both, to avoid “groupthink.”

2.    确定设计规则。告诉您的团队一些您想要制作的游戏类型，并询问他们希望看到什么。从开放式问题开始，在确定了广泛的领域后再进行更具体的提问。如果该小组表示他们非常喜欢或非常不喜欢某件事，请找出原因。（如果该小组还很年轻，很难表达复杂的情感，这可能很难；这将由您作为设计师来推断。）

2.    Identify design rules. Tell your group a little about the kind of game you’d like to make, and ask them what they’d like to see. Start with open-ended questions and get more specific after you’ve identified broad areas. If the group says they really like or really don’t like something, find out why. (This may be difficult if the group is young enough that it’s difficult for them to express complicated emotions; it will be up to you as a designer to draw inferences.)

3.    集思广益。

3.    Brainstorm concepts.

4.    创建可交付成果。

4.    Create deliverable.

挑战 2——超越 DDR

CHALLENGE 2—BEYOND DDR

《劲舞革命》的制作方 Konami希望扩大他们目前的市场。但是，他们不希望你只是制作续集——他们希望你分析他们目前的硬件，即舞蹈垫，并想出至少五种不同的用途，每种用途都针对不同的市场。如果你的新设计与舞蹈、舞蹈或革命无关，他们会更加印象深刻。他们暗示他们希望看到一些针对老年人或残疾人的产品，但除此之外，他们依靠你的聪明才智。

Konami, the makers of Dance Dance Revolution, want to expand their current market. However, they don’t want you to just create a sequel—they want you to analyze their current hardware, the dance pad, and come up with at least five different uses for it, each of which targets a different market. They’d be even more impressed if your new designs have nothing to do with dancing, or dancing, or revolution. They’ve hinted that they’d like to see something for senior citizens or disabled individuals, but other than that, they’re relying on your ingenuity.

所需组件

Components Required

·      一个舞蹈垫或一个用于播放图像的互联网连接

·      A dance pad, or an Internet connection for an image of one

可交付成果

Deliverable

·      一份以创新方式使用 DDR 垫来针对新受众的游戏提案。提案应包括概述、人口统计分析、功能集和界面模型，或

·      A game proposal using the DDR pad in an innovative way that targets a new audience. The proposal should include an overview, demographic breakdown, feature set and interface mockups, or

·      列出五个潜在市场以及该市场的核心和简要特征集，或

·      List of five potential markets along with a core and brief feature set for that market, or

·      完成后的非正式展示

·      Informal presentation after completion

建议流程

Suggested Process

1.    集思广益，想出各种行动。 除了跳舞，你还能用跳舞毯做什么？想想你认识的身体素质和年龄各不相同的人。他们可能会用这样的游戏毯做什么？

1.    Brainstorm actions. Aside from dancing, what different things could you do with a dance pad? Think of people you know with varying levels of physical ability and ages. What could they possibly use a game pad like this for?

2.    确定功能集。为您的游戏创意选择一个或多个可能的目标市场。接下来，在创建功能集时，停下来考虑目标市场。如果您的目标市场包括幼儿，那么在“帮助”部分添加一个包含饮食信息和食谱的大型部分可能不是最好的选择。您的功能集应包含三到五种专门针对目标市场设计的不同内容。

2.    Determine the feature set. Select one or more possible target markets for your game idea. Next, pause to consider that target market as you create your feature set. If your target market includes young children, having a big “help” section with diet information and recipes may not be the best thing. Your feature set should incorporate three to five different things that are designed specifically with the target market in mind.

3.    创建可交付成果。

3.    Create deliverable.

挑战 3——针对普通人

CHALLENGE 3—TARGETING THE EVERYMAN

Deer Hunter在沃尔玛购物者中大获成功。然而，令许多人惊讶的是，这款产品竟然是沃尔玛自己定制的。他们正在寻找一款能够吸引在他们商店购物的每个人的游戏。现在，为了应对这一挑战，我们假设 Target 想要一款类似但新颖的游戏。您的目标市场是 35 岁以上的男性，他们对电子游戏不感兴趣。Deer Hunter让他买了，这家零售商愿意打赌其他产品也能让他买。

Deer Hunter was a tremendous success with Wal-Mart shoppers. What’s surprising to many, however, is that this product was made to order by Wal-Mart itself. They were looking for a game that would appeal to the everyman who shopped in their stores. Now, and for the sake of this challenge, let’s assume Target wants something similar but new. Your target market is the 35+-year-old male who’s not interested in video games. Deer Hunter got him to buy, and this retailer is willing to bet something else will, too.

所需组件

Components Required

·      用于研究的互联网连接。

·      Internet connection for research.

·      男性杂志，如《GQ》、《体育画报》或《男性健身》

·      Men’s magazine such as GQ, Sports Illustrated, or Men’s Fitness

·      焦点小组（可选，但推荐）

·      Focus group (optional, but recommended)

可交付成果

Deliverable

·      向我们的模拟 Target 的领导进行正式的推介。选择几个人组成一个模拟评审委员会，最好不要与另一个也在处理同一挑战的设计团队有关。（寻找真正的零售主管是没有必要的，可能也不建议，而且肯定没有那么有趣。）

·      A formal pitch presentation to the powers that be at our fake Target. Select several individuals to make up a mock review board, ideally not involved with another design team also working on the same challenge. (Finding actual retail executives is not necessary, probably not advisable, and definitely not as entertaining.)

·      一份概念文件

·      A concept document

·      完成后的非正式讨论

·      Informal discussion after completion

建议流程

Suggested Process

1.    分成三至四人一组。

1.    Break into groups of three to four people.

2.    分析你的市场。 这个“普通人”是谁？他到底喜欢什么？他在业余时间做什么？如果他有时间，他会在业余时间做什么？为了应对这一挑战，你必须突破自己的局限和知识范围（除非你是那个对电子游戏不感兴趣的普通人，却不知何故得到了这本书）。体育游戏立即浮现在脑海中，但请记住，你的普通人还没有被Madden或市面上的赛车游戏迷住。

2.    Analyze your market. Who is this “everyman” and what exactly does he like? What does he do in his spare time? What would he do in his spare time if only he had time to do it? For this challenge, you must push yourself beyond the bounds of who you are and what you know (unless you are that everyman who is not interested in video games that somehow got his hands on this book). Sports games immediately come to mind, but remember, your everyman hasn’t been hooked by Madden or the racing games that are out there.

3.    进行市场调查。找到这个群体最喜爱的杂志。他们读什么杂志可能预示着他们可能会玩什么。浏览当地报纸的“活动”专栏。几乎每个城市都有各种各样的活动。哪些活动可能会吸引这些观众？

3.    Do market research. Find the most popular magazines for this demographic. What they read could be an indication of what they might play. Explore your local newspaper’s “Events” column. Most every city has a variety of events going on. Which events are likely to attract that audience?

4.    寻找焦点小组。 亲自、通过电话或在线建立焦点小组并征求他们对爱好和兴趣的意见。每个兴趣和爱好都可能是一个可行的游戏。您将带着对游戏的想法回到这个焦点小组。一定要问他们喜欢某个特定活动、运动或爱好的哪些方面。这些是您可能希望在游戏中反映出来的功能。

4.    Find a focus group. In person, over the phone, or online, establish a focus group and solicit their opinions on hobbies and interests. Each of these might be a possible game. You will return to this focus group with ideas you have for a game. Be sure to ask them what it is they like about a particular event or sport or hobby. These are features you may want to reflect in the game.

5.    集思广益。根据你所做的研究进行集思广益。有哪些游戏值得一玩？

5.    Brainstorm. Brainstorm on the research you’ve done. What games suggest themselves?

6.    确定功能集。选择一个或多个想法并为您的游戏创意开发一个功能集。查看焦点测试中的注释或评论，以开发玩家认为有趣的功能。您的功能集应包含三到五种专门针对目标市场设计的不同功能。

6.    Determine the feature set. Select one or more of the ideas and develop a feature set for your game idea. Review the notes or comments from your focus test to develop features that your players thought would be interesting. Your feature set should incorporate three to five different things that are designed specifically with the target market in mind.

7.    返回焦点小组（可选）。返回焦点小组，与他们讨论您对游戏的想法。

7.    Return to focus group(optional). Return to your focus group to discuss the ideas you have for a game with them.

8.    创建可交付成果。

8.    Create deliverable.

挑战 4——加勒比地区定向旅游

CHALLENGE 4—CARIBBEAN TARGETED TOURISM

为了扩大人们对加勒比海文化的了解，除了旅游之外，加勒比海的几个国家联合起来，创建了一系列游戏，重点介绍各个岛屿的历史、文化、人民和艺术。他们希望这些产品能够超越人们对传统刻板印象的认识，突出独特的岛屿体验。最终，他们希望这些项目能够为各个岛屿带来新的商业机会和投资。这些产品的目标客户应该是四十多岁的中上阶层非洲裔美国人，这是一个利润丰厚的市场，熟悉西印度群岛的旅游业，之前曾是许多国家旅游局的目标客户。这个非营利组织很快指出，你必须做好功课。之前的开发商忽略了其他岛屿，而是让牙买加著名的文化代表整个加勒比海。

In an effort to expand knowledge of its culture beyond tourism, several Caribbean countries have banded together to create a game series that focuses on the history, culture, people, and art of the individual islands. They want the products to go well beyond the traditional stereotypes people think of and highlight the unique island experiences. In the end, they hope these projects will spur new business opportunities and investment on the individual islands. The products should target middleand upper-class African Americans in their forties, a lucrative market familiar with West Indian tourism and previously targeted by numerous countries’ tourism boards. The nonprofit organization is quick to note that you must do your homework. Previous developers neglected to include other islands, and let the well-known culture of Jamaica speak for the Caribbean as a whole.

所需组件

Components Required

·      用于研究的互联网连接

·      Internet connection for research

·      针对非裔美国人的杂志，如《Ebony》和《Black Enterprise》

·      Magazines that target African Americans such as Ebony and Black Enterprise

·      焦点小组（可选，但推荐）

·      Focus group (optional, but recommended)

可交付成果

Deliverable

·      一份研究分析报告将提供给开发者，开发者可以使用这份研究来开发游戏或

·      A research analysis report that would be provided to a developer who could, in turn, use this research to develop the game or

·      向三个选定国家的“代表”进行正式的推介。每个大使将与该国经济发展部门的一名人员一起出行。为了应对这一挑战，请选择三到六个人组成审查委员会，最好不要与另一个也参与同一挑战的设计团队有关。这些人不必来自这些国家，但至少应该在推介前阅读有关该国的概述。他们的目标是为您提供有关设计的反馈。

·      A formal pitch presentation to the “representatives” of three selected countries. Each ambassador will be traveling with a person from the country’s economic development authority. For the sake of this challenge, select three to six individuals to make up the review board, ideally not involved with another design team also working on the same challenge. These individuals need not be from these countries, but should at least read an overview on the country before the pitch. Their goal is to give you feedback on the design.

·      主游戏屏幕的模型和至少五个任务的列表（如果适用）以及项目概念艺术的集合。

·      A mock-up of the main gameplay screen and a list of at least five missions, if applicable, and a collection of concept art for the project.

建议流程

Suggested Process

1.    分成三至四人一组。

1.    Break into groups of three to four people.

2.    选择三个岛屿作为目标。选择使用相同语言的岛屿会更容易。

2.    Select three islands to target. It will be easiest for you if you select islands that speak the same language.

3.    分析您的市场。 什么吸引人们来到加勒比海？那里有哪些商业机会？如果最终目标是吸引人们到岛上投资和寻找商业机会，那么请探索人们愿意投资的东西以及哪些商业是有意义的。低廉的劳动力成本、极高的识字率和流利的英语使用者已经促使一些企业在那里开设商店。不要忘记美丽的海滩和生活质量。做好研究，并利用目标岛屿经济发展办公室已经为您完成的研究。确保游戏反映您的目标市场。快速浏览游戏商店中的游戏就会发现，绝大多数游戏都没有反映您的目标市场。

3.    Analyze your market. What attracts people to the Caribbean? What opportunities for businesses are there? If the ultimate goal is to attract people to the islands for investment and business opportunities, explore things someone would invest in, and what businesses make sense. A low labor cost, very high literacy rates, and fluent English speakers have already caused some businesses to set up shops there. Don’t forget the amazing beaches and the quality of life. Do your research and take advantage of research that the economic development offices of the target islands have already done for you. Be sure that the game reflects your target market. A quick look at games in game stores shows that the great majority of games do not.

4.    进行市场调查。 当目标市场中的人们计划度假或投资时，他们会关注哪里？是什么促使他们考虑这些机会？比较其他国家如何向这个特定市场推销自己。

4.    Do market research. When people in the target market are planning a vacation or planning for investment, where do they look? What makes them consider these opportunities? Compare how other countries market themselves to this specific market.

5.    寻找焦点小组。 亲自、通过电话或在线建立焦点小组，征求他们对商业和投资的意见。询问他们对加勒比海的看法，了解他们的第一印象。鼓励他们谈论他们的游戏习惯（如果有的话），不要忘记提及休闲游戏。

5.    Find a focus group. In person, over the phone, or online, establish a focus group and solicit their opinions on business and investment. Ask them their thoughts on the Caribbean and find out what their initial impressions are. Encourage them to speak about their game-playing habits, if any, and don’t neglect to mention casual games.

6.    集思广益。收集所有信息，集思广益，提出各种可能性。您会创建一款包含所有岛屿的游戏，还是创建一款可以塑造每个岛屿的引擎？

6.    Brainstorm. Take all the information in and brainstorm possibilities. Will you create one game featuring all the islands or an engine into which each island can be molded?

7.    确定核心和功能集。确定项目的核心。由于其性质，它似乎有几种不同的可能性。为您的项目确定优先级，并专注于此。为每个岛屿开发一个包含四到五个不同功能的功能集。岛屿之间可能共享一些功能。

7.    Determine the core and feature set. Determine a core for the project. Due to its very nature, it seems to have several different possibilities. Establish a priority for your project, and focus on that. Develop a feature set with four to five different features per island. Islands may share some features with one another.

6.    返回焦点小组（可选）。与上一个挑战一样，返回焦点小组，与他们讨论您对游戏的想法。

6.    Return to focus group (optional). As in the previous challenge, return to your focus group to discuss the ideas you have for a game with them.

7.    创建可交付成果。

7.    Create deliverable.

更简单的变体

Easier Variant

使用上述所有步骤，但要针对您的家乡州或国家/地区创建可交付成果，以针对其他州或国家的人们。

Use all the steps above, but create a deliverable for your home state or country that targets people in another state or country.

变体

Variant

为爱尔兰政府创建一款针对爱尔兰裔美国人的游戏。不过，不要只关注圣帕特里克节之类的事情。相反，要关注人们在一年中的其他 364 天想要访问爱尔兰并投资的原因。最终，与上一个挑战一样，游戏必须促进爱尔兰岛的投资和商业机会。您可以自由地针对特定的人群，例如爱尔兰裔美国艺术家或游戏开发者。

Create a game for the Irish government that targets Irish Americans. Don’t exclusively focus on things like St. Patrick’s Day, however. Instead, focus on the reasons why someone would want to visit and invest in Ireland the other 364 days of the year. Ultimately, as with the previous challenge, the game must foster investment and business opportunities in the Green Isle. Feel free to target particular subsets of people, such as Irish-American artists or game developers.

铁人设计师挑战赛 5 — 教育类 MMO

IRON DESIGNER CHALLENGE 5—THE EDUCATIONAL MMO

在线环境为来自世界各地的人们提供了完美的学习环境。同时，它们也让人们接触到来自世界各地的玩家。您已获得美国教育部的一笔拨款，用于开发一款针对中学生的 MMO，并向他们传授您选择的主题。他们还希望您加入某种机制，以鼓励玩家留存，甚至鼓励角色成长。但是，不能有任何暴力。

Online environments provide a perfect learning environment for people from all over the world. At the same time, they also expose people to players from all over the world. You have received a grant from the U.S. Department of Education to develop an MMO that targets middle-school students and teaches them about a topic of your choice. They also want you to incorporate some kind of mechanic that encourages player retention and maybe even character growth. However, there can’t be any violence.

沟通是另一个问题。显然，接触其他文化并成为积极的社交网络的一部分对这个年龄段的人来说是可取的。另一方面，如果你有一个标准的聊天界面，那么什么都可以说（并且已经和将会说），包括亵渎和攻击性的诽谤和绰号。因此，你不允许任何形式的自由文本通信（例如不受限制的聊天或留言板）。不过，玩家应该能够相互交流并进行社交......无论如何。

Communication is another issue. Obviously, exposure to other cultures and being part of a positive social network is desirable for this age group. On the other hand, if you have a standard chat interface, anything can (and has and will be) said, including profanity and offensive slurs and epithets. Therefore, you are not allowed any kind of freeform text communication (such as unrestricted chat or message boards). Still, players should be able to communicate with one another and be social... somehow.

所需组件

Components Required

·      用于研究的互联网连接

·      Internet connection for research

可交付成果

Deliverable

·      显示非自由格式文本社交计划的模拟截图

·      Mock-up screenshot that shows your plan for non–freeform-text socialization

·      一页纸的玩家保留计划（一旦他们尝试了，怎样才能让他们继续玩下去？）

·      One-page plan for player retention (what will keep them playing once they try it?)

·      不含暴力的角色发展系统的一页设计规范（他们如何让他们的角色升级？）

·      One-page design spec for a character-development system sans violence (what do they do to make their characters gain levels?)

·      一份两页的摘要，描述玩家体验（他们在游戏中做什么？）

·      A two-page summary that describes the player experience (what do they do in the game?)

·      正式的项目推介演示

·      A formal pitch presentation on the project

建议流程

Suggested Process

1.    分成三至四人一组。

1.    Break into groups of three to four people.

2.    选择一个主题。

2.    Choose a topic.

3.    分析您的市场。 六到八年级的孩子玩什么类型的游戏？他们在这些年级学习了什么？您的 MMO 应该采用类似的学习原则。但是，请记住，游戏是极好的教学工具，因此有机会吸引学生参与其中。

3.    Analyze your market. What types of games do children in grades six to eight play? What are they learning during those grades? Your MMO should incorporate similar learning principles. However, bear in mind that games are excellent teaching tools, and as such, have an opportunity to pull students into the experience.

4.    考虑潜在的机制。你的出版商提出了两个具有挑战性的要求——社交时不使用文字聊天，角色发展时不使用暴力。花点时间考虑这两个要求，并考虑游戏机制如何实现这两个要求。如何在没有无限制文字聊天的情况下融入社交氛围？信不信由你，这种氛围是存在的。探索游戏以外的社交网络，看看其他空间如何在没有任何聊天形式的情况下变得异常社交。然而，对于这个挑战，想想玩家可以通过文字以外的其他方式进行交流的方式。

4.    Consider potential mechanics. Your publishers have asked for two challenging things—socializing without text chat and character development without violence. Spend some time on both of these requests and consider how a game’s mechanics could create them. How can you incorporate a social atmosphere without unrestricted text chat? It exists, believe it or not. Explore social networks beyond games and see how other spaces have become exceptionally social without any form of chat at all. For this challenge, however, think of a way that players can communicate through something other than text.

5.    创建可交付成果。

5.    Create deliverable.

变体

Variants

选择过去发生的令人不安的事件或时间。记住这种不安，创建一个 MMO，让人们真正站在那些经历过你选择的主题的人的角度。

Select a disturbing event or time that happened in the past. Keeping that disturbance in mind, create an MMO that allows people to actually walk in the shoes of those who experienced the topic you’ve selected.

非数字短片

NON-DIGITAL SHORTS

以下每部短片都针对不同的市场或相同的需求。短片可以根据市场需求轻松修改，从而提供更多设计选择。

Each of the following shorts deals with a different market or a need of the same. The shorts can easily be modified by changing the market requirement for even more options for design.

1.    设计一款纸牌游戏，其中所有规则都可以在游戏的前五分钟内通过观察和模仿来学习。

1.    Design a card game in which all the rules are learnable through observation and imitation within the first five minutes of play.

2.    选择一款非常注重文字的游戏（比如大富翁），并重新设计它，使其完全不需要阅读。

2.    Choose a game with a heavy emphasis on text (such as Monopoly) and redesign it to require no reading at all.

3.    选择一款学习难度较高的游戏（比如任何微型游戏），并重新设计它，使其8-10岁的儿童可以在没有成人监督的情况下玩。

3.    Choose a game with a steep learning curve (such as any miniature game) and redesign it to be playable by children aged 8-10 without adult supervision.

4.    确定一个吸引中年女性群体的问题或兴趣，并以此为核心设计一款游戏。

4.    Identify one issue or interest that appeals to the middle-aged female demographic and design a game using that as the core.

5.    选择一个常见的视频游戏节省时间惯例，例如生命计或库存屏幕，并设计一个基于图块的游戏，教非游戏玩家如何理解这个惯例。

5.    Choose a common video-game time-saving convention, such as the life meter or the inventory screen, and design a tile-based game that teaches non-gamers how to understand this convention.

6.    创建针对高中女生的领土获取棋盘游戏。

6.    Create a territorial acquisition board game targeted to high-school girls.

7.    创建一个持久的回合制策略游戏，纳入小学课程或娱乐活动。

7.    Create a persistent turn-based strategy game to be incorporated into the curriculum or recreation of an elementary-school class.

8.    制作一款以方块为基础的游戏，旨在向潜在移民介绍您的祖国。假设玩家不会说您的国家语言。

8.    Create a tile-based game intended to introduce your home country to potential immigrants. Assume the players don’t speak your national language.

9.    选择一款针对儿童的纸牌或牌类游戏（如Ruckus或Go Fish ），并重新设计它以用于赌场，提供二十一点级别的挑战和奖励。

9.    Choose a card or tile game targeted to children (such as Ruckus or Go Fish) and redesign it for use in a casino, offering challenge and reward on the level of Blackjack.

10. 用任何媒介创建一款游戏，旨在帮助一些人从中途之家的生活环境重新融入社会。

10. Create a game in any medium that’s designed to assist some population as it reenters the community from a halfway-house living situation.



 

 

12：学习不熟悉的体裁

12: Learning an Unfamiliar Genre

大多数情况下，发行商会向开发商提出提案请求 (RFP)，并针对特定游戏类型进行考虑。他们会说：“给我们一个针对儿童的 MMO 游戏吧。这个市场每年都在增长。”

Most of the time, a publisher approaches a developer with a request for a proposal (RFP) with a specific genre in mind. “Give us an MMO targeted at kids,” they’ll say. “That market’s growing more every year.”

在某种程度上，这介于制作续集和瞄准市场之间。从技术上讲，你瞄准的是喜欢特定类型游戏的玩家市场，并且游戏应该符合该类型，就像续集符合其前作一样（尽管限制较少）。

In a way, this is somewhere between making a sequel and targeting a market. You are, technically, targeting the market of people who like games of a particular genre, and it’s expected that the game will conform to that genre in the same (if less restrictive) way that a sequel will conform to its predecessors.

如果你设计过几十款 RPG 游戏，玩过数百款 RPG 游戏，而现在有人要求你制作一款 RPG 游戏，这没什么问题。如果你被要求制作一款社交模拟游戏或体育游戏，而你从未设计过，那么你最好找到一种学习的方法……而且要快。

If you’ve designed dozens of RPGs and played hundreds more, and you’re asked to create an RPG, this is not a problem. If you’re asked to create a social simulation or a sports game, and you’ve never designed one, then you’d better find a way to learn... and fast.

为什么要从类型开始？

WHY START WITH GENRE?

发行商通常会要求发行特定类型的游戏。游戏类型与市场一样易于追踪；业界会记录游戏类型的表现（即每年制作了多少款不同游戏以及购买了多少款游戏）。发行商可以通过游戏类型发现某些市场趋势，这些趋势预示着盈利机会。例如，如果他们知道世界上有 2500 万 RPG 玩家，并且没有其他 RPG 游戏将在明年第四季度在主流游戏机上发布，他们可能会决定资助一款游戏，因为他们认为如果这是该类型的粉丝唯一的选择，他们会购买任何东西 。这样的机会让《召唤师》 等游戏尽管评分平平，但仍能获得高额利润（公平地说，《博德之门：黑暗联盟》等游戏的评分非常出色，但如果它们没有在某个方向上垄断该类型游戏至少六个月，销量可能会更低）。

Publishers often request a specific genre. Genres, like markets, are easy to track; the industry keeps numbers on how well genres are doing (in terms of how many different games are produced, and how many purchased, each year). Publishers can detect certain market trends by genre that signal a financial opportunity. For example, if they know that there are 25 million RPG players in the world and that no other RPGs have been announced for Q4 of next year on the leading console, they might decide to finance one on the theory that fans of the genre will buy anything if it’s their only choice. Such opportunities are what allow games like Summoner to be highly profitable, in spite of mediocre review scores (and, to be fair, games like Baldur’s Gate: Dark Alliance, which have outstanding review scores, but might have done less in sales if they didn’t also have a monopoly on their genre for at least six months in either direction).

如何开始

HOW TO START

充分了解一种新游戏类型并设计出一款游戏是设计师面临的最困难的事情之一。研究的基本原则在这里得到了充分体现，但如果你想尊重玩家，研究的要求会比平时更高。

Learning a new genre well enough to design a game in it is among the most difficult things a designer can be asked to do. The basic principles of research are present here in all their glory, but the research is more demanding than usual if you want to honor the player.

玩，玩，玩

PLAY, PLAY, PLAY

如果你刚接触所设计的游戏类型，那就让自己沉浸在该类型的世界中。玩你能玩到的每一款游戏，特别关注该类型中的最新游戏。先以玩家的身份玩游戏，尝试寻找乐趣。如果你觉得它没有乐趣，至少要弄清楚为什么它会让足够多的人支持该类型（但要认真考虑你是否是适合这份工作的设计师）。先以玩家的身份玩游戏，再以设计师的身份玩游戏，弄清楚哪些机制可以创造乐趣。说“我们应该包含功能 X，因为著名的游戏 Y 有它”很容易，说“我们不应该包含功能 X，以便将我们的游戏与著名的游戏 Y 区分开来”也同样容易；知道何时说这两种话至关重要。

If you’re new to the genre you’re designing in, immerse yourself within the genre’s world. Play every game you can get your hands on, paying particular attention to the latest games in the genre. Play first as a player, trying to find the fun. If it’s not fun for you, at least try to figure out why it might be fun for enough other people to support the genre (but seriously consider whether you’re the right designer for the job). After playing as a player, play as a designer, figuring out what mechanics create the fun. It is easy to say “we should include feature X because well-known Game Y has it” and equally easy to say “we shouldn’t include feature X in order to differentiate our game from well-known Game Y”; knowing when to say each is critical.

玩几款同类型的游戏并进行比较。它们有哪些相似之处？有哪些不同之处？玩家期望该类型的游戏有哪些惯例？哪些表面上的相似之处是您可以以创新的名义进行更改的？

Play a number of games in the genre and compare them. What are the similarities? What are the differences? What are the genre conventions that your players will expect to be there, and what are the superficial similarities that you could get away with changing in the name of innovation?

读书

HIT THE BOOKS

提示指南为游戏玩家和游戏设计师提供了大量信息。这些书通常会揭示游戏的内部运作，向您展示道具统计数据、游戏策略等，这些信息有助于分析系统的运作方式。虽然它与查看产品的代码或设计文档不同，但它提供的信息比您仅仅玩游戏所能获得的信息要多。

Hint guides offer a lot of information to gamers and game designers. Often, these books expose the inner workings of a game, showing you item statistics, play strategies, and the like that are helpful in trying to analyze how a system works. It’s not the same as looking at the code or design doc of a product to be sure, but it’s more information than you’d get by merely playing the game.

除了提示指南外，还有许多关于游戏设计的书籍，有些专门针对特定类型，如 MMO 和 RPG。如果你真的刚开始接触该类型，花时间阅读一本书可以帮助你从另一个角度了解该类型的基础知识。通常，这类书籍是由行业专业人士或对该类型有深入研究的人撰写的。

In addition to hint guides, many books have been written on game design, and some specifically target particular genres like MMOs and RPGs. If you’re literally at a starting point with the genre, the time you spend with a book helps you to understand the genre’s fundamentals from another perspective. Typically, such books are written by industry professionals, or those who have extensively studied the genre.

游戏与设计

PLAYING VERSUS DESIGNING

当然，玩游戏不同于设计游戏。理论上，任何会开车的人都可以开着宝马在路上行驶。然而，很少有人能设计或制造驱动这辆宝马的引擎。这个比喻也适用于游戏。仅仅因为你可以玩一款游戏——甚至玩得很好——并不意味着你理解了这款游戏的设计决策，更不用说复制它的成功了。

Playing a game, of course, is different from designing one. In theory, anyone who can drive can hop into a BMW and drive it down the road. However, few people could design or build the engine that powers that same BMW. This metaphor extends itself to games. Just because you can play a game—and even play it well—doesn’t mean that you understand the design decisions that made that game what it was (or is), let alone replicate its success.

查看评论

REVIEW THE REVIEWS

查看你玩过的游戏的专业评论，尤其是由该类型游戏的粉丝撰写的评论。他们在游戏中寻找什么样的东西？当该类型的游戏达不到标准时，他们会批评什么？

Look at professional reviews of the games you’ve played, especially those written by reviewers who are fans of the genre. What kinds of things are they looking for in a game, and what kinds of things do they criticize when a game in the genre is not up to par?

理想情况下，当你完成研究时，你应该成为新流派的忠实粉丝……或者至少你应该对该流派有了前所未有的新认识。这将使你更容易选择合适的核心。

Ideally, by the time you’re done researching, you should be a major fan of the new genre... or at least you should have a new-found appreciation for that genre that you never had before. This will make it much easier for you to choose an appropriate core.

挑战

CHALLENGES

 

 

最好在自己的时间里重复本章中所有你不熟悉的游戏类型（包括新创建的游戏类型）的挑战……然后再被要求制作新类型的游戏。每次你从事新类型的工作时，你都会学到一系列可以应用于其他类型的新技术，并增强你作为设计师的技能。如果你被要求设计一款超出自己舒适区的游戏，现在花费的时间也将得到百倍的回报。

It’s best to repeat the challenges in this chapter for all genres that you’re unfamiliar with (including new ones as they are created) in your own time... before you are called upon to make a game in a new genre. Every time you work in a new genre, you learn a palette of new techniques that can be applied to other genres, and you strengthen your skills as a designer. The time spent now will also be paid back a hundredfold later if you ever are asked to design a game outside of your comfort zone.

有些演员和音乐家因其角色或风格多样性而闻名。向他们学习，扩大您了解并能设计的游戏范围。通过这样做，您可以拓宽在陌生领域工作的能力，还可以增加被录用的机会。（例如，寻找 RTS 设计师的工作室会询问有关该类型的面试问题，如果您能很好地回答这些问题 - 即使它不是您最喜欢的类型 - 也会给人留下更好的印象。）

Some actors and musicians are known for their range of roles or styles. Be like them and expand the range of games you understand and can design. By doing so, you broaden your ability to work in unfamiliar territory, and you also increase your chances of getting hired. (For example, a studio looking for an RTS designer will be asking interview questions about that genre, and if you can answer them well—even if it’s not your favorite genre— you’ll make a much better impression.)

事实上，如果你被要求设计一款完全陌生的游戏类型，那么请尝试找一位之前成功制作过该类型游戏的人当导师。历经磨难绝不是好事。幸运的是，当你换工作时，这种情况通常会发生。在这种情况下，希望有人能先教你一些诀窍，然后再给你机会让他们自食其果。

In reality, if you are asked to design a game in a wholly unfamiliar genre, try to mentor under someone who’s successfully made games in that genre before you. Trial by fire is rarely a good thing. Fortunately for you, stuff like this normally happens when you change jobs. In that case, someone else hopefully shows you the ropes before they give you an opportunity to hang yourself with them.

挑战 1——体育比赛

CHALLENGE 1—SPORTS GAMES

由于你运气极好，美国艺电公司聘请你的工作室在现代游戏机上重制经典的《突变联盟足球》和《突变联盟曲棍球》游戏，并更新图形、增加新游戏模式和一项新运动——板球。

Due to your incredible luck, Electronic Arts has hired your studio to do a remake of the classic Mutant League Football and Mutant League Hockey games on a modern console with updated graphics, a new game mode, and a new sport—cricket.

如果您和许多游戏开发者一样，并不是体育迷。但是，许多游戏玩家都是体育迷，喜欢玩基于这些体育的游戏。由于接触和理解一项体育运动在很大程度上受到您所处文化的影响，因此您可能以前从未玩过板球……甚至不知道板球是什么。大多数美国人并不热衷于足球、橄榄球或板球，而加勒比地区的许多人没有美国棒球和足球也很容易生活。在一种可能不熟悉的运动的新类型中工作会带来相当大的挑战。

If you’re like many game developers, you’re not a big sports fan. However, many game players are big fans of sports and like to play games based on those sports. Since exposure to and understanding of a sport is heavily influenced by the culture in which you live, there’s a chance you might not have played cricket before... or even know what it is. Most Americans aren’t rabid over soccer, rugby, or cricket, while many people in the Caribbean can easily live without American baseball and football. Working in a new genre with a possibly unfamiliar sport creates quite a challenge.

所需组件

Components Required

·      互联网连接（用于研究）

·      Internet connection (for research)

·      至少一款代表你所选运动的现代游戏和一台可以玩该游戏的机器（可选）

·      At least one modern game representing the sport you have chosen and a machine to play it on (optional)

·      突变联盟足球或突变联盟曲棍球以及一台游戏机（可选）

·      Mutant League Football or Mutant League Hockey and a machine to play it on (optional)

可交付成果

Deliverable

·      所选运动的规则摘要（需要非常简短，不必完整）以及

·      Rules summary of the chosen sport (you will need to be very brief instead of being complete) and

·       关于这项运动的“市场调研”摘要，详细说明这项运动的“乐趣”在哪里基于这项运动的视频游戏摘要，详细说明可用的游戏模式以及每种模式的好坏及其原因（您可以玩游戏或阅读专业评论）以及

·       “Market research” summary on the sport, detailing where the “fun” of the sport is Summary of a video game(s) based on the sport, detailing the game mode(s) available and whether each was good or bad and why (you may either play the game or read professional reviews) and

·      双人游戏过程中所有主要屏幕的屏幕模型以及该屏幕上的控制列表以及

·      Screen mockups of all major screens during the play of a two-player game and a list of controls on that screen and

·      关于你的游戏概念的提案和非正式演示

·      Proposal and informal presentation on your game concept

建议流程

Suggested Process

1.    研究这项运动。 你可以在维基百科上找到新球迷的信息，但更好的来源是专业体育协会的网站。（许多网站都有新球迷可以去的地方。）许多体育运动可以在电视上观看，看一两场比赛（特别是如果你能和已经是球迷的朋友或同事一起看，因为他们可以向你解释这项运动的优点）会帮助你了解它的吸引力。

1.    Research the sport. You can find information for new fans on Wikipedia, but a better source will be the professional sports association’s Web site. (Many of them have a place to go for newcomers.) Many sports can be watched on TV, and watching a game or two (especially if you can watch it with a friend or colleague who is already a fan, as they can explain the game’s finer points to you) will help you to understand its appeal.

2.    研究现代游戏。根据您选择的运动来玩现代游戏。特别注意设计师需要注意的方面：游戏模式、游戏体验和（可选）用户界面。人工智能 (AI) 也很重要，但超出了本练习（或整本书）的范围。

2.    Research the modern games. Play a modern game based on the sport you chose. Pay particular attention to those aspects that a designer needs to be aware of: the game modes, the play experience, and (optionally) the user interface. The artificial intelligence (AI) is also important, but is beyond the scope of this exercise (or indeed, this entire book).

3.    研究旧游戏。了解Mutant League系列游戏的吸引力。它们并非某项运动的完美复制品，因此可能对纯粹主义者没有吸引力，但它们确实吸引了许多体育游戏玩家，甚至一些不喜欢这项运动的玩家。如果可以，请玩游戏；如果不能，请阅读评论和常见问题解答，以熟悉Mutant League游戏与其代表的运动之间的区别。

3.    Research the old games. Find the appeal of the Mutant League series of games. They are not perfect copies of a sport and therefore may not appeal to purists, but they do appeal to many sports gamers, and even a few gamers who aren’t fans of the sport. Play the games if you can; if not, read reviews and FAQs to familiarize yourself with the difference between the Mutant League games and the sports they represent.

4.    集思广益。集体讨论可能的概念。留出两个小时的时间就一个概念达成一致，并充实一些基本细节。

4.    Brainstorm. In a group, discuss potential concepts. Allow two hours to agree on a single concept and flesh out some basic details.

5.    创建可交付成果。 包括所有拟议游戏模式的描述以及游戏机制与实际运动机制之间的差异。

5.    Create deliverable. Include a description of all proposed game modes and the differences between the mechanics of your game and those of the actual sport.

6.    设计用户界面（可选）。在研究和设计过程中，反复查看屏幕布局和控件。体育游戏为设计师提供了许多挑战，包括：玩家如何选择挥杆方式和时间？玩家如何决定投球？他如何做到这一点而不让其他玩家看到他的选择？玩家如何决定何时将回合交给另一支球队？有哪些摄像机角度可用于观看比赛，如何控制它们？在双人模式下，单摄像机视图还是分屏视图（水平或垂直）更好？在游戏过程中（以及在动作中断时，如果有的话），应该始终在屏幕上显示哪些类型的信息（HUD）？同时控制多个人的最佳方法是什么？您是否一次控制一个玩家，并有一些直观的方式在玩家之间切换，还是同时指挥整个团队？

6.    Design the user interface (optional). In your research and in your design, look at the screen layout and controls again and again. Sports games offer numerous challenges for designers, including the following: How does a player choose how and when to swing? How does a player decide his or her pitch? How can he do this without the other playing seeing his choice? How does a player decide when to pass the turn to the other team? What camera angles are available for viewing the game, and how are they controlled? Is it better in two-player mode to have a single camera view or a split screen view (horizontal or vertical)? What kinds of information should be displayed on-screen (HUD) at all times during play (and at breaks in the action, if any)? What is the best way to control multiple people at once? Do you control one player at a time and have some intuitive way to switch between players, or direct the entire team concurrently?

如果您没有游戏来进行研究，那么查看专业游戏评论中包含的屏幕截图将是必要的。

If you do not own a game to do your research, looking at screenshots included in professional game reviews will be necessary.

对于您的交付成果，请包括双人游戏期间所有主要屏幕的屏幕模型（这些可以粗略地手工绘制并标记以显示屏幕元素）（例如，没有必要显示主菜单或保存/加载屏幕）。对于每个模型，请清楚地显示屏幕的不同部分以及每个部分显示的信息。此外，还要为每个屏幕提供一个现代控制台上的控制器，并显示哪些控件与哪些游戏内操作相对应。

For your deliverable, include screen mockups (these can be crudely drawn by hand and labeled to show the screen elements) of all major screens during a two-player game (for example, it is not necessary to show the main menu or saving/loading screens). For each mockup, clearly show the different parts of the screen, and what information is shown in each part. Also include a controller on a modern console for each screen and show what controls map to what in-game actions.

变体

Variant
