2.    Propagation. In Assassin, a game usually involves people signing up in advance of the event. Most Facebook games propagate after people have already started playing. How does your game propagate through social networks?

3.    通知。玩家暗杀他人时如何收到通知？当他们自己被暗杀时如何收到通知？此通知是否用于宣传游戏？被淘汰的玩家会怎样？

3.    Notification. How are players notified when they assassinate someone? When they are themselves assassinated? Is this notification used to propagate the game? What happens to players who are eliminated?

4.    把各个部分拼凑起来。整理一下你的机制列表并进行反思。这是你喜欢玩的游戏吗？如果不喜欢，你可以做哪些改变？你的规则是否足够简单，任何人都可以开始玩这个游戏而不会感到迷茫？

4.    Put the pieces together. Assemble your list of mechanics and reflect on them. Is this a game you would like to play? If not, what changes could you make? Are your rules simple enough that anyone could start playing this game without feeling lost?

5.    创建可交付成果。

5.    Create deliverable.

非数字短片

NON-DIGITAL SHORTS

自穴居人时代以来，游戏本质上就是一种社交体验。社交网络的新形式让我们可以考虑游戏的新形式（并重新考虑旧形式）。这些短片鼓励这种探索。

Since the caveman days, games have inherently been a social experience. The new forms of social networking allow us to consider new forms (and reconsider old forms) of games. These shorts encourage this type of exploration.

1.    创建一个基于扩展网络、强调不断扩大领土的图块游戏。

1.    Create a tile-based game that emphasizes the expanding territory based on an expanding network.

2.    创建一款纸牌游戏，鼓励玩家团队合作以实现目标。

2.    Create a card game that encourages players to work in teams to achieve their goal.

3.    在商业世界中，最重要的是你认识谁。创建一个强调这种动态的棋盘游戏。

3.    In the world of business, it’s all about who you know. Create a board game that emphasizes this dynamic.

4.    鸟儿成群结队，鱼儿成群游动。考虑一下这与社交网络有何关联，并制作任何类型的游戏。

4.    Birds move in flocks, and fish move in schools. Consider how this relates to social networking and make a game about it of any type.

5.    创建一款游戏，帮助一家使用至少三种上述成功社交网络机制的非营利组织发展。该游戏将在其下一次年度会议上开始。

5.    Create a game that will help grow a non-profit organization that uses at least three successful social-networking mechanics noted above. The game will begin at their next yearly conference.

6.    制作一款游戏，旨在帮助在流动工人人口众多的城市建立社区意识。该游戏将在大型公寓大楼的新社区中心大楼内推出。

6.    Create a game designed to help build a sense of community in a city with a high-transient worker population. The game will be launched at the building of a new community center in a large apartment complex.

7.    设计一款 Facebook 棋盘游戏。

7.    Design a Facebook board game.

8.    有一款游戏，简称为The Game ，是现实生活中的游戏。游戏的目的是不要去想The Game。如果你发现自己在附近有其他人时想着The Game，你必须公开宣布你刚刚输了，并且必须向任何询问的人解释规则。The Game以许多 Facebook 游戏所希望的方式病毒式传播，但它实际上算不上一款游戏。设计一款更好的游戏——其机制 涉及招募新玩家，并且可以无限增长。

8.    There is a game, simply called The Game, that is played in real life. The object of The Game is to not think about The Game. If you find yourself thinking about The Game when other people are nearby, you must publicly declare that you just lost, and you must explain the rules to anyone who asks. The Game spreads virally in a way that many Facebook games would like to, but it’s not really much of a game. Design a better one—a game where the mechanics involve recruiting new players, which can grow infinitely.

9.    设计一个游戏来帮助人们克服聚会或其他社交活动中的害羞。

9.    Design a game to help people overcome shyness at parties or other social events.

10. 设计一款棋盘游戏或纸牌游戏，让玩家在游戏内为每一位新玩家介绍游戏时获得奖励。这种机制必须由玩家自己管理，而不是游戏开发商或其他第三方。

10. Design a board or card game that gives players in-game rewards for every new player they introduce to the game. The mechanisms for doing so must be administered by the players themselves, not the game developer or some other third party.

资源

RESOURCES

Costik “I Have No Words and I Must Design,” http://www.costik.com/nowords.html

Siegel 的“Facebook 游戏设计非常不同”，可在线访问：http://numberless.net/blog/ 2008/01/12/game-design-for-facebook-is-a-very-different-beast/

Siegel “Game design for Facebook is a very different beast,” available online at http://numberless.net/blog/ 2008/01/12/game-design-for-facebook-is-a-very-different-beast/

Applied01 “停车大战：裂缝是‘可能的奖品’”，可在线访问：http://bbrathwaite.wordpress.com/2008/03/29/parking-wars-the-crack-that-is-the-possible-prize/

Applied01 “Parking Wars: The Crack that is the ‘Possible Prize’,” available online at http://bbrathwaite.wordpress.com/2008/03/29/parking-wars-the-crack-that-is-the-possible-prize/

Applied03 “Facebook 游戏玩家传播”，可在线访问 http://bbrathwaite.wordpress.com/2008/01/06/facebook-casual-game-player-propagation/

Applied03 “Facebook Game Player Propagation,” available online at http://bbrathwaite.wordpress.com/2008/01/06/facebook-casual-game-player-propagation/

Applied04 “Facebook 应用程序传播：人质事件与报复”，可在线访问：http://bbrathwaite.wordpress.com/2008/01/07/facebook-app-propagation-thehostage-situation-retaliation/

Applied04 “Facebook App Propagation: The Hostage Situation & Retaliation,” available online at http://bbrathwaite.wordpress.com/2008/01/07/facebook-app-propagation-thehostage-situation-retaliation/
